loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare his food and do some remodeling in his kitchen and his vehicle.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es: Lorena de 25 años vive con su cónyuge y su hijos de 3 años de edad al suroccidente de la ciudad donde tiene el negocio de vender mercancía variada, como cosméticos que promociona mediante guías especializadas o catálogos  y también tiene una distribuidora de helados, negocios,  que surgieron gradualmente para resolver la necesidad de generar ingresos para el hogar y con el fin de aumentar su bienestar. Las compras de estos productos las hace de contado, mientras las mercancías las vende a crédito y los helados de contado. Su meta mas adelante es fortalecer su pequeña distribución de helados y convertir este negocio en heladería, donde sus clientes tengan un ambiente confortable, mientras degustan y se refrescan.  Así mismo sueña con adquirir su propia casa y diariamente este pensamiento es su mayor impulso. En la actualidad esta aplicando a su credikiva primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará cosméticos que vienen con descuentos especiales y perfumes encargados, a propósito del día del amor y de la amistad, época en la cual ocurre un repunte de sus ventas  y desde dos meses antes los clientes de Lorena han encargado, las mercancías que servirán de obsequio para expresar manifestaciones de cariño a sus familiares, amigos y enamorados.
texts.en:
Lorena, 25, lives with her spouse and 3-year-old child in the southwest part of the city where she has a business selling varied merchandise like cosmetics that she sells via specialized catalogues or guide books.  She’s also a frozen treat distributor.  These businesses arose gradually to meet the need she had to generate income for her home in order to increase wellbeing.  She pays cash for these products but sells them on credit; the frozen treats are sold for cash.  Her goal for later on is to strengthen her small frozen treat distributorship and turn it into an ice-cream shop where her customers will have a comfortable environment while they enjoy their treats and refreshments.  She also dreams with acquiring her own house and this is her daily motivation.

She is currently applying for her Kiva loan, the first financing she’ll receive from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy cosmetics that are on special discount and perfumes she has pending orders for due to the Day of Love and Friendship which is a time when sales spike and customers have placed orders with Lorena with up to two months advance notice for items that they intend to use as gifts to show their affection for family members, friends and sweethearts.

loans.use: to buy specially discounted cosmetics and perfumes on order.

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam is 22 years old and lives with her parents in Gaza. In 2011, Ahlam noticed that there are no clothing stores in the area that she lives in so she decided to open one of her own. 

She now hopes that through this loan she would be able to buy new clothes, stands, and furniture for the store. She hopes that by doing so, she will have more customers coming in, and her income will increase at the same time.

loans.use: buy new clothes, stands, and furniture for the store

loans.name: Intesar

texts.en:
Intesar is a young Palestinian woman; she is married with no children yet. She lives in Gaza city located in Palestine. Intesar and her husband are both employed in the Palestinian Red Crescent Society with decent salaries. 

Intesar wants to improve her house by installing tiles and window frames, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for these expenses, so she needs to take out a loan of $1,500 from FATEN. 

When Intesar takes the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to pay for theses expenses and live with her family in healthier and better housing conditions. Intesar is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: To pay for installing windows frames and tiles for her house.

loans.name: Israa'

texts.en:
Israa' is a 21-year-old woman who is married, has one son, and lives in the Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza, Palestine. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee and makes a decent salary. 

Israa' wants to purchase new home furniture but the amount of money she has isn't enough, so she needs to take out a loan of $700 from FATEN. When Israa' gets the FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase new home furniture. That will change her family life positively and give her family better living conditions. 

Israa' is a conservative woman, her husband is photographed instead in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 21-year-old single man from Gaza, who lives with his mother, father, three brothers, and two sisters. Hassan has decided that he would like to use a portable stand (basta) in which he could sell shoes for both men and women.

He hopes that through this loan he will be able to buy shoes in order in bring in customers, which will hopefully increase his income too.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 26-year-old man who lives in Gaza city located in Palestine. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. 

Mohammad has started a new project on his own which is in the field of plumbing. He needs to purchase plumbing equipment to use in his work, but because of the salary he gets, he hasn't enough money, so he wants to take out a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. 

When Mohammad takes out this FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will purchase the plumbing equipment that he needs to start working on his new project. That will add another source of income and improve his living conditions. Mohammad is photographed in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: to purchase plumbing equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase 12 sheep and five lambs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase three cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Qalib

texts.en:
Qalib  is 43 years old. He is married and has two children. Qalib has worked with livestock for 10 years. He is very experienced and has the special skills in livestock care that help him to develop his business. He raises and sells sheep and sells meat. 

Qalib is requesting a loan of 1,500 AZN to enable him to purchase more sheep. This will allow enable him to increase the meat produced and will provide income security to the family. His current profit per month is about 350 USD, and he would like to increase it to 500 USD. 

The income will enable Qalib to provide for his family, take good care of his animals and supply his neighbors and permanent vendors with quality meat. 

This will be his third loan and he has a good credit history

loans.use: to purchase 20 sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods to increase profit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase one milk cow and fodder.

loans.name: Reem

texts.en: Reem is a 22-year-old young woman. She is married and has one son and two daughters. She lives in Gaza city located in Palestine. Her husband is a taxi driver. Reem wants to pay for licensing and insuring the taxi, which is the only source of income for her family, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay. Therefore, she needs to take a loan of $1,500 from FATEN. When Reem takes the FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to pay for licensing and insuring the taxi. Her husband will work extra hours to improve the family income and live in better life conditions. Reem is a religious conservative woman, so her husband is photographed next to the taxi the family owns.

loans.use: To pay for licensing and insuring the taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stationary for his bookshop and furniture

loans.name: Ishmael

texts.en:
Ishmael is a farmer in Nkubu area of Central Kenya. He is 41 years old and has been in active farming for 21 years. His farm produces fish, bananas, eggs, and milk, all of which go to the local market. He is also employed at a field office with the government.

He has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds and to construct a poultry unit. He adds that some will go into other farming inputs and repairs in the irrigation system for his bananas and fish farming. He says the businesses will succeed due to his experience. Ishmael says lack of funds is the main challenge to farmers in the area.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds and to construct a poultry unit.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a father of seven children, all of whom are adults. He has been in farming for 20 years, employing one farmhand and producing bananas, milk, eggs, and coffee. He gets additional income from his general retail shop in the local market.

Andrew has requested a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water tank and irrigation pipes. He says the irrigation system will make his banana farming an all-season production and improve his living standards.

He laments high input costs for fertilizers and farmhands.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank and irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Areej

texts.en: Areej is a 30-year-old young woman who is married and has no children yet. Her husband works as a driver for cargo. Areej wants to pay for making repairs and painting the vehicle, as it is the only source of income for the family, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for these expenses. Therefore, she needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Areej gets her FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to pay for all these expenses and improve the vehicle the family has. Her husband will serve more clients and work extra to have a better income and improve the family living conditions. Areej is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead next to the vehicle the family owns.

loans.use: To pay for repairing and painting his vehicle.

loans.name: Nahla

texts.en:
Nahla is a 36-year-old single lady who has been living with her mother and sister since her father passed away.

To be able to support herself and to help with the family’s income, Nahla started almost two years ago working as an independent dressmaker and operating a small clothing retail business at home.

Now Nahla has applied for a loan to buy more clothing materials and fabric so she can one day have her own sewing workshop.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials and fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana con su anterior credikiva compró calzado, ropa para damas perfumes, bolsos y electrodomésticos menores que vendió rápidamente y con ello aumentó ligeramente su capital de trabajo. En la actualidad se prepara para recibir su segundo credikiva el que invertirá en mercancía encargada por sus clientes, a propósito de que se acerca el día del amor y de la amistad y sus clientes quieren obsequiar pequeños detalles a sus familiares, amistades y enamorados, que Juana les conseguirá como productos de belleza, accesorios, bolsos, ropa etc. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Que la vida los colme de bendiciones por realizar tan noble labor.” Si usted quiere leer la historia de Juana ingrese al siguiente enlace:

http://kiva.org/lend/255703
texts.en:
Juana used her previous Kiva loan to buy footwear, women’s clothes, perfume, purses and small home appliances that she quickly sold and slightly increased her working capital with this.  Currently, she’s getting ready to receive her second Kiva loan that she’ll invest in merchandise her customers have ordered from her due to the approach of the Day of Love and Friendship when her customers want to give small gifts like beauty products, accessories, purses, clothes, etc. to their family members, friends and sweethearts that Juana will get for them.  

Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: “May life shower you with blessings for doing such noble deeds.”  If you’d like to read Juana’s story, please click on the following link: 

http://kiva.org/lend/255703

loans.use: to buy beauty products, accessories, purses, clothes, etc.

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es: Cindy de 19 años de edad  y estudiante universitaria,estudiante de Contaduria Pùblica, es una joven que tiene grandes sueños, y diariamente trabaja para lograr alcanzarlos; entusiasta y emprendedora, desde muy niña ha mostrado sus dotes de gran comerciante, primero vendiendo dulces a sus compañera de clases y hoy genera sus propios ingresos, mediante una actividad independiente, porque ella vende productos por catálogos y tiene una miscelánea donde comercializa cosméticos, accesorios, artículos para el hogar, bolsos y calzados fabricados por su propia madre. Ella es muy conocida en su sector en la universidad y en muchos lugares donde llega pues siempre busca las mejores negociaciones para sus clientes, a quienes vende de contado y principalmente a crédito. Su meta es terminar su carrera universitaria y adquirir su propia vivienda y lograr el fortalecimiento y la estabilidad de su negocio. , en la actualidad su negocio genera una rentabilidad del 23,38( y una rotación de sus cuentas por cobrar de 25 días, indicadores financieros desde los cuales proyectamos su potencial crecimiento y auguramos el éxito de la inversión de su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará cosméticos y accesorios en oferta de sus revista, pues su experiencia le indica que debe estar lista para una de las épocas del año en la cual hay mayor repunte en sus ventas y no le quiere fallar a sus rentables clientes.
texts.en:
Cindy, 19, is a university student majoring in public accounting.  She’s a young woman with big dreams and she works daily to make them reality.  She’s enthusiastic and enterprising and has shown her great commercial gifts since she was a little girl first selling candy to her classmates and now earning her own income through an independent activity because she sells catalogue products and she also has a general store where she sells cosmetics, accessories, items for the home, purses and footwear manufactured by her own mother.  She is very well known in her sector in the university and in many other places where she goes because she’s always looking for the best deals for her customers that she sells to for cash and mainly on credit.  Her goal is to finish her university career and get a house of her own and to strengthen her business’ stability.

At present, her business has a 23.38% profit margin and a 25-day accounts receivable turnover.  With these financial indicators we are able to predict potential growth and augur success for the investment of her Kiva loan, the first financing she gets from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy cosmetics and accessories that are on special offer in her catalogues because her experience has taught her that she must be ready for one of the seasons of the year when sales spike and she does not want to disappoint her profitable customers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and accessories from her catalogues that are on special promotion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paper goods, school supplies, accessories and another telephone plan.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Alirio

texts.es: Alirio de 38 años vive al sur de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos de 7 y 14 años. Allí tiene un negocio donde prepara y vende jugos de naranjas, arepas, empanadas, patacones, deditos y buñuelos. Su horario de trabajo es desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde de lunes a domingos, su competencia es poca y sus clientes están conformados por transeúntes, de la ciudadela 20 de Julio, comunidad que combina espacios comerciales, formales e informales, escenarios deportivos, multifamiliares, casas, conjuntos de apartamentos y el negocio de Alirio esta es justamente la vía mas transitada. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y diariamente y sus compras también son de contado y su frecuencia es diaria. En su negocio trabaja con su esposa y el 100% de sus ingresos provienen de esta actividad. Su meta mas adelante es adecuar el local donde muy pronto se trasladará, en un sitio cercano al actual. Mientras Alirio trabaja para conseguir sus sueños, maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor al 24,5%, una rotación de inventarios diaria, indicadores a partir de los cuales proyectamos su potencial crecimiento y auguramos una exitosa inversión de su credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará,   naranjas e insumos para la preparación de sus fritos, una cava, un termo, y hará reparaciones a su carricoche  de jugos, desde el cual hace todo el despliegue de ventas de su inversión.
texts.en:
Alirio, 38, lives in the south part of the city with his spouse and two children who are 7 and 14 years old.  He has a business there where he makes and sells orange juice, arepas [stuffed turnovers], turnovers, fried banana chips, fried cheese sticks and fried dough.  His work schedule is 7am to 5pm Monday through Sunday.  He has little competition and his customers are passersby in the 20 de Julio neighborhood, a community that combines both formal and informal commercial spaces, sports venues, multiple unit apartment buildings, houses, apartment complexes and Alirio’s business is located precisely on the busiest street.  His sales are cash and daily and his purchases are also cash and also daily.  He works in the business with his wife and 100% of his income comes from this activity.  His goal for later on is to furnish the locale he plans to move into very soon; it’s a place near the current one.

While Alirio works toward making his dreams come true, he manages a profit margin on sales of no less than 24.5% and a daily inventory turnover rate, indicators from which we can project potential growth and augur a successful investment of his Kiva loan which is the second financing he’s gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and that he’ll use to buy oranges and ingredients for his fried food snacks, a keg, a thermos and he’ll do some repairs on his fruit juice cart which is what he uses for all his sales.

loans.use: to buy oranges and ingredients for his fried fast foods, a keg, a thermos and he'll do some repairs on his fruit juice cart.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: Leonardo está satisfecho porque recibirá su nuevo credikiva, con el primero compró una moto para transportar los productos con una carrerilL.. En L. actualidad esta aplicando a su segundo credikiva con el cual comprará una moto tanques y filtros. Su mensaje a los financiadores D. Kiva es el siguiente:  “ Quiero darles mis agradecimientos por brindarme L. oportunidad D. ensanchar mi negocio y D. esta forma aumentar mis ingresos y poder cumplir con L. necesidad básica D. mi familia y contribuir D. esta manera a solucionar los problemas D. falta D. agua potable en mi ciudad.” Si usted quiere conocer L. historia D. Leonardo ingrese al siguiente enlace:  http://kiva.org/lend/208554
texts.en:
Leonardo is pleased to receive a new Kiva loan. His first loan was used to buy a motorcycle for transporting his products using a trailer. At the moment, he is applying for a second Kiva loan so that he can buy a motor, tanks, and filters.

He sends the following message to Kiva lenders: “I want to express my appreciation for giving me the opportunity to expand my business and increase my income so that I can meet the basic needs of my family and contribute toward solving the problems caused by a lack of clean drinking water in my city.”

To learn more about Leonardo’s story, please click on the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/208554

loans.use: to buy a motor, tanks, and filters.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to enlarge his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy upholstery materials, rubber, nails, thread, fabrics, and lining.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing for women, men, and infants so that he can fulfill his outstanding orders.

loans.name: Gulputa

texts.en:
Gulputa a 51-year-old woman who lives with her children in Agsu. She established her business selling provisions such as eggs, soap, shampoo, and candy.

Gulputa began her business because she needed a reliable source of income to support her family. Her eldest son greatly helps her. She would like to take out this loan in amount of 1000 Azerbaijan new manat (AZN) to purchase more inventory to increase her income. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen de 42 años vive al sur de la ciudad con su esposo y su hijo de 10 años de edad. Allí  se dedica a vender mercancía variada, especialmente ropa para damas, caballeros e infantil. Su negocio lo inició hace 20 años,  comprando ropa para ella que luego la vendía al público, ya que le solicitaban la que ella elegantemente  lucia. Su principal clientela está situada en su pueblo natal entre los departamentos de Sucre y Bolívar, sus ventas las realiza a crédito  a una clientela acreditada y muy juiciosa con sus pagos a plazos. Su sueño es hacer crecer al negocio de tal manera que logre estudios profesionales de calidad para su hija. Con su credikiva primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, comprará ropa en todas las líneas, femenina, masculina e infantil, y está segura de una inversión exitosa por su experiencia, porque trabaja sobre pedidos y con mercancía de buena calidad, variedad y precios cómodos, así como también con plazos otorgados ajustados a su clientela meta. Carmen en su negocio maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor de 32 días, una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 30 días, indicadores desde los cuales proyectamos su potencial crecimiento y auguramos una inversión de su credikiva exitosa.
texts.en:
Carmen is 42 years old and lives to the south of the city with her husband and 10-year-old child. She sells a variety of merchandise, especially clothes for women, men, and infants. Carmen started her business 20 years ago, buying clothes that she would sell later to the public. She ordered clothes that have an elegant look. Her main customers are from her hometown and from the Departments of Sucre and Bolívar. Carmen extends credit to her customers and is very judicious with the payment terms that she offers. Her dream is to grow her business so that her daughter can pursue a quality professional education. With her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, Carmen will buy clothing for women, men, and infants of all brands.

Carmen is confident that her investment will be successful because of her experience. She works primarily from orders and offers a variety of good quality merchandise at affordable prices. Carmen also adjusts her payment terms based on the customers that she is targeting. She manages to generate a profit from her sales within a period of no less than 32 days. Her accounts receivable period is 30 days. These indicators are the signs that predict her potential growth, which will increase with a successful investment of her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothes for women, men, and infants.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza de 37 años de edad vive con sus tres hijos en las edades de 6 a 16 años en el municipio de Malambo a 15 minutos de Barranquilla. Allí tiene un negocio a través del cual, vende artículos de la canasta familiar, de contado y con algunos créditos,  entre los que se cuentan ranchos, víveres, refrescos, enlatados, carnes etc. Su principal clientela son las amas de casa, quienes se acercan a comprar los insumos que requieren para la preparación de sus comidas diarias o de los artículos de aseo para su hogar.  Inició su negocio vendiendo mercancía para apoyar la gestión de su hogar, hace 4 años con un capital que le dio su esposo y con su gran esfuerzo compró estantes y lo ubicó en una habitación de su casa. Gradualmente su negocio fue creciendo y pudo hacerle adecuaciones al local y comprar enfriador, vitrinas e ir renovando su infraestructura,  hoy convertido en una gran tienda. Hace 2 años alquiló su negocio pues se separó de su esposo y fue a vivir donde su madre, pero antes de 8 meses debió retomarlo  pues el arrendatario le dio un mal manejo, así que con su trabajo diario y persistente ha logrado salir adelante y hoy está entusiasmada para hacerlo crecer. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprara víveres al por mayor de mayor rotación, para ganar descuentos con la compra de contado y en mayor volumen. Sus inventarios rotan cada 28 días y la rentabilidad sobre las ventas no es inferior al 13,75% indicador desde los cuales auguramos su potencial crecimiento y una inversión exitosa con su credikiva.
texts.en:
Maritza is 37 years old and has three children between the ages of 6 and 16. They live in the town of Malambo, which is 15 minutes away from Barranquilla. Maritza has a business where she sells basic household goods for cash and sometimes on credit. Her inventory includes snacks, provisions, soft drinks, canned goods, meats, and other products. Her main customers are housewives looking to buy ingredients for preparing their daily meals or for cleaning products to use around the home. Maritza started her business four years ago with some capital given to her by her husband. Through hard work, she purchased shelving and established the store in her home. Her business grew gradually and she later equipped her store with a cooler and some display cabinets. She also renovated the infrastructure so that now she has a larger store. Two years ago she began renting out her business because she separated from her husband and then went to go live with her mother. Within the last eight months, she has reclaimed her business due to bad management by her tenant. Through her daily work, Maritza has managed to press forward and is excited about being able to grow.

For this reason she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy in large quantities those products that have high turnover so that she can obtain discounts for paying with cash and buying in bulk. Her product turnover period is 28 days and she maintains a profitability rate from her sales of no less than 13.75%. These indicators signal an increase in her growth potential and a successful investment from her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in bulk for her store.

loans.name: Yolbin

texts.es: Yolbin de 34 años de edad vive al sur de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 18 y 10 años y se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada y también comercializa con productos,  mediante guías especializadas de importantes empresas.  Cuando inició su negocio lo hizo con el ánimo de apoyar los gastos de su hogar y lograr un mayor bienestar, empezó vendiendo calzado, luego agregó productos por catálogos y  así construyó su propio capital en la medida en que fueron aumentando sus ventas. Hoy funciona también con una vitrina en la terraza de su vivienda y con estantería donde exhibe los productos que vende. Su meta mas adelante es convertir su miscelánea en un gran almacén, donde los clientes reales y potenciales  vean y compren todo lo que necesitan y desean. Los principales mercancías que vende son perfumes, cosméticos,  tarjetas, artículos de miscelánea y electrodomésticos por pedidos, sus clientes están ubicados en los barrios del sur de la ciudad y compra de contado de acuerdo a pedidos y teniendo en cuenta lo que se va agotando en su exhibición, sus principales proveedores son los almacenes del centro de la ciudad y las revistas especializadas,  que frecuentemente sacan para la venta buenas promociones. Su negocio lo atiende un tío,  pues ella en las mañanas genera ingresos por trabajo de medio tiempo, mientras en la tarde atiende su negocio. Su competencia es alta, pero en el sector hay mucha afluencia de público y hay ingresos para todos los negocios. Su mayor desafío es la falta de capital de trabajo,  para dar respuesta rápida a sus clientes  y esto es lo que justamente conseguirá con su credikiva:  un capital nuevo para comprar de contado y en volumen,  mercancías como artículos para el hogar, adornos navideños, regalos de amor y amistad, todo esto teniendo en cuenta,  que es el segundo semestre del año y se acerca una época de gran despliegue de ventas y Yolbin sabe que es tiempo de repunte de ventas.
texts.en:
Yolbin is 34 years old and lives to the south of the city with her husband and two children (ages 18 and 10). She has a store where she sells various merchandise, but she also offers products through specialty catalogs of major companies. When she started her business, Yolbin was excited about being able to help with the household expenses and achieve greater well-being. She began selling shoes, but later added products through catalogs. As a result, she built up her own capital which she used to increase her sales. Today she also has a display case on the terrace of her house and shelves where she can show off the products that she sells. Her goal moving forward is to convert her variety shop into a large store where current and potential customers can come to buy everything they need and want. The main products that she sells are perfumes, cosmetics, cards, miscellaneous items, and household appliances by request. Yolbin takes into account what is lacking in her displays. Her main suppliers are the warehouses in the central part of the city and the specialty catalogs that frequently advertise good promotional offers. Her business is managed by her uncle since she works at a part-time job in the mornings to earn income. In the afternoons, Yolbin takes over her business. Competition is high, but there is much public demand to generate income for all the businesses. Her greatest challenge is the lack of operating capital that would enable her to respond quickly to her customers. This is exactly why she is applying for a Kiva loan.

Having this new capital will enable her to buy merchandise with cash and in bulk such as household goods, Christmas decorations, and gifts for Colombian Valentine’s Day. Yolbin is taking into consideration that this is the second half of the year when a large number of products are introduced to sell. Therefore, she should see a spike in sales.

loans.use: to purchase household goods, Christmas decorations, and gifts for Colombian Valentine’s Day.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro  de 22 años de edad vive en el municipio de Soledad,  a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, y tiene un restaurante en plena vía principal del municipio, negocio que emprendió después de trabajar en un restaurante de un familiar y con su liquidación capitalizó su experiencia y emprendió su propia aventura de negocios. Compró el menaje de cocina, 8 juegos de sillas y mesas, 1 congelador, una estufa y alquiló un local  y dio rienda suelta a su capacidad de trabajo. Su experiencia y su potencial emprendedor y su Fortaleza en el trabaja han logrado,  que cada día le vaya mejor. Hoy está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, su credikiva,  con el cual comprará  materias primas e insumos para elaborar sus comidas, pues es necesario disminuir los costos de transporte,  bajando la frecuencia de las compras y también obtener descuentos por el sistema de compras en volumen  y de contado. Su meta más adelante es ubicar un nuevo punto de mercado,  para el montaje de una sucursal, y justamente  su gran desafío es tener varios puntos de comercialización de comidas. Mientras Pedro en su juventud trabaja para lograr sus grandes sueños, maneja un margen de contribución del 36% y una rentabilidad no menor del 17, 26% desde la cual proyectamos su potencial crecimiento y auguramos una inversión exitosa de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Pedro is 22 years old and lives in the town of Soledad, which is 15 minutes away from the city of Barranquilla. He has a restaurant that is located along the main thoroughfare in town. Pedro started this business after working at a family-owned restaurant. He used his severance pay to establish his own business venture. Pedro bought cookware, eight sets of tables and chairs, a freezer, and a stove to furnish a rental location where he is able to carry out his work. He relies on his experience, his potential as an entrepreneur, and his inner strength with the expectation that each day will get better. Today he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

Pedro’s Kiva loan will be used to buy ingredients and supplies for preparing his dishes. It is necessary for him to lower his transportation costs and reduce his frequency of purchases by buying in bulk and with cash so that he can obtain discounts. His goal in the future is to find a new location where he can set up a branch for his business because his greatest challenge is not having enough outlets where he can sell his food. In the meantime, Pedro makes the most of his youth so that he can achieve great dreams. He manages a contribution margin of 36% and profitability of no less than 17.26%. These indicators signal his potential for growth. His Kiva loan is expected to result in a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and supplies for preparing his dishes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 10 sheep and feed for them.

loans.name: Ruby Del Carmen

texts.es: Ruby  de 46 años de edad  vive al suroccidente de la ciudad  con su cónyuge y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 16 a 25 años. Su negocio consiste en la venta de gallinas criollas, patos y pollos, el cual inició en el año 2003, cuando con un pequeño capital se dedicó a criarlos en el patio de su casa, engordarlos y venderlos, actividad en la que es apoyada por su cónyuge. Su negocio gradualmente ha ido creciendo y hoy sus principales clientes no solo son las amas de casa,  sino también restaurantes y negocios que venden comidas especiales y  que ayudan a su crecimiento,  pues siempre le refieren nuevos compradores. Su mayor desafío es tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para comprar nuevos galpones y alimentar el número de estos animales que cada día es mayor. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprará galpones para la cría de sus animales, con los cuales estaría aumentando los ingresos, de los que depende en mayor parte su familia. La utilidad  generado por esta actividad es no menor del 34% desde la cual proyectamos su potencial crecimiento y auguramos una inversión exitosa con su credikiva.
texts.en:
Ruby is 46 years old and lives in the south-west of the city with her husband.  She has four children aged between 16 and 25.  Ruby's business is selling creole hens, ducks and chickens.  She started her business in 2003 when, with a small amount of capital, she started raising these animals in her yard, fattening them and selling them.  She is supported in this business by her husband.

Ruby's business has gradually grown and now her main customers are not only housewives but also restaurants and businesses that sell special meals.  This helps her business' growth as they always refer new buyers to her.  Ruby's main challenge is having enough working capital to buy new sheds and to feed her increasing number of birds.  For this reason, she is requesting a Kiva loan to buy sheds in which to raise her animals.  This will help increase her income which her family depends upon.  The profit she makes in her business is not less than 34%.  We envisage her potential growth and predict a successful investment of her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy sheds for her animals

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en: Kamil,  45, lives with his wife and two children in Agsu where he has been operating a jewelry business for more than 15 years. Currently attempting  to expand his business, Kamil is requesting his first loan from Aqroinvest and Kiva for 1000 AZN in order to buy a new assortment of jewelry.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of jewelery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stove and utensils

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bananas and consumables to prepare food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and household goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cheese, bread, yogurt and blancmange.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products and fruit with which to stock up her restaurant and juice bar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tools to start a carpentry business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open a small store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food and meat for the preparation of her dishes.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng, 36, is a married woman and the mother of three children. She has been living in the Baray district of Prey Chor Province. Leng and her husband are domestic rice farmers. They have a few plots of farmland that came from their grandparents many years ago. To generate additional incomes, they also catch some fish for selling. The family is able to earn a daily profit of approximately $4.5 USD. 

Leng and her husband are looking for a loan to buy nets and traps to support their fishing activity. 

For her future plan, Leng hopes to use her increased income to enlarge her crop-planting business and her fishing business, to build a bigger house, and to support her children to finish at least the high school level. 

Note: Leng and husband are pictured with their young child in front of their house.

loans.use: to buy nets and traps for fishing.

loans.name: Welchela

texts.en:
Welchela is 33 years old and lives in Brgy. Cantabon, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is a single parent with three children.

To earn a living, Welchela has a business selling of dried fish. She earns about PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. Welchela requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase more dried fish.

Welchela has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for four months. In the future, she would like to acquire more dried fish to be sold in her municipality.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.en:
Rafaela is married and has one child. Rafaela is 48 years old and lives in Brgy. Caitican, Siquijor, Siquijor.

Rafaela is engaged in buying and selling vegetables to earn a living. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to purchase more bulk vegetables of different kinds so that she can make a bigger profit.

Rafaela has been a member of PMPC for five months. In the future, she hopes to have bigger income for her family with the help of her husband and will be engaged in buying and selling fruits, too.

loans.use: to purchase more bulk vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam, 26, is from Kampong Chhnang Province and cultivating rice is part of her daily routine. Rice is an essential product very important to Cambodian people. She learned to do this from her grandmother. Her husband, Song, assists her with the farm work. On the other hand, Mrs. Sam’s husband also works as a building worker to generate extra profit. They are blessed with two children who still depend on their incomes. Because this is the rainy season, the rain often falls down and it is hard for them to keep their firewood. Their firewood always wets when it rains cats and dogs. Because of that, Mrs. Sam would like to borrow some funds from Kiva in order to buy a cart for storing up her firewood in a dry place and she can also uses it to pick up other merchandise.

loans.use: to buy a cart for storing up her firewood.

loans.name: Otgontsagaan

texts.en:
Otgontsagaan is 37 years old, divorced and lives with his aged mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running a taxi business since 2008 and before that, he used to work as a driver in a private company. He owns a small piece of land and a house. 

Currently, he is planning to build a garage beside the house because the Mongolian winter is freezing cold and it badly affects a car to stay outside during the winter. But because of financial difficulties, he needs additional funding to build it.
 
Otgontsagaan is taking a loan to purchase some bricks and other building materials to build a garage inside his fence.

loans.use: To purchase some bricks and other building materials to build a garage inside his fence.

loans.name: Sagynbu's Group

texts.en:
Sagynbu is the leader of this group. She is 60 and a widow. She has raised two daughters. The first daughter is married and lives separately with her family and the second daughter studies at university. 

In order to earn money Sagynbu breeds livestock and then resells it at a higher price after being fattened. In this way, she earns about 1,200 KGS per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. 

In the future Sagynbu wishes to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Lynn

texts.en:
Lynn is a single mother with one child. She is 41 years old and lives in Brgy. Candanay Sur, Siquijor, Siquijor. Lynn raises hogs to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase piglets and feeds for hog raising.  

Lynn has been a member of PMPC for one month. In the future, she hopes she can renovate her house and support her child in tertiary education.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feeds for hog raising.

loans.name: Rod Darwin

texts.en:
Rod Darwin and his family live happily in a village. He is 37 years old and has five school-age children. He and his wife aim to educate all their children so that they will become professionals someday. Despite the hardships of life, they are striving hard to earn and save for education purposes. They own and manage a butcher shop in the market selling fresh meat of pigs, cows and goats. 

Rod Darwin aims to improve this business so that he will earn a higher income. He is requesting for a loan of P20,000 to buy pigs, cows and goats to butcher and sell in the market. He hopes that this loan will help him to improve his business. 

In the future, Rod Darwin is hoping that his business will grow and expand so that he will become financially stable and give his children a bright future.

loans.use: to buy pigs, cows and goats to butcher and sell in the market

loans.name: Anarkan's Group

texts.en:
Anarkan is the treasurer of this group. She is 40 and married to a crane operator. Together with her husband she brings up two daughters: the older daughter is at university and the second goes to school. Anarkan works as a cleaner and her monthly salary is 2500 soms. She is also engaged in livestock breeding and reselling livestock after fattening to earn additional money to meet the family needs. Anarkan has applied for the loan because she needs additional funds to pay for her daughter’s education at university. In the near future she plans to start building a shed for livestock. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Osnia

texts.en:
Osnia is age 28  and married to Amos, a 28 year old motor-taxi driver. They are blessed with a son  Arly, 8 who is studying in the second grade of theelementary school. Osnia owns a business of selling vegetables i.e. tomatoes, mustard greens, kangkung, carrots as well as betel nut and betel vine. She has been engaged in this business for 12 years. The business is located 500 meters from her house and she usually operates the business from 7 am to 8 pm. 

Currently, Osnia is planning to improve her business by renovating her business place and adding more stock of vegetables and kitchen herbs. To do so, Osnia is seeking for a loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM.

loans.use: To renovate her business place and to add more stock of vegetables and kitchen herbs to sell

loans.name: Juliet Helen

texts.en:
Juliet Helen is engaged in managing a variety store in her  village. She is now 47 years old and has two school-age children. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she needs to earn more income to support her children's education and satisfy their basic necessities. 

Juliet Helen aims to improve her variety store to increase her income. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy toothpaste, beverages, seasonings, bread, junk foods, noodles, candies, eggs and soft drinks to sell. She believes that this loan will help to increase her product offerings and income. 


At this time, Juliet Helen is striving hard to make the business grow so that it will become viable and profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, beverages, seasonings, bread, junk food, noodles, candies, eggs and soft drinks to sell in the village

loans.name: Gulbubu's Group

texts.en:
Gulbubu is the leader of this group. She is 47 and married to a driver. Together with the husband she brings up a son, who is ten years old and studies at school. Two years ago with an initial investment of 17000 soms, Gulbubu started to sell fruits and vegetables. At the moment her business runs well and she earns about 4500 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more fruits and vegetables in order to increase the commodity turnover of her business. In the future with the profits gained from the business, Gulbubu wishes to purchase a piece of land to start building a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a good client who has been making a living for the last three years by running a butcher's shop. She is 38 years old, married and has two children. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a long-time client, and has applied for her first loan to expand her business by buying more meat to sell. She hopes to make profit and use the return to go into business as a farmer. Her dream is to earn enough money so that she and her children can live well.

loans.use: to expand her meat-selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy four sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: For the last 11 years, Peter has made a living as a farmer in the town of Ndunyu Njeru. He is 28 years old, married and has two school-aged children. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and is applying for his fourth loan. He paid all of his previous loans fully and on time.  He plans to use this latest loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for a new crop. In future, Peter hopes to be one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years. He is 28 years old and married to his wife Jane. They have one child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD  by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He has paid all of his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Joseph hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus is 28 years old, married, and has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the last two years. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the field officers and is requesting his second loan.  He repaid his previous loan of 50,000 KES on time.  He plans to use this loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and a dairy cow.

In the future, Cyrus hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Naivasha town.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy timber for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy scrap materials like plastics, bottles and cans to sell in the junk shop.

loans.name: Charo

texts.en:
Charo is a 34 year-old married father of two children ages three and six years-old. Charo is a photographer in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. He has been in this business for one year and it has been a success. 

This marks his first borrowing from KADET LTD to finance his business. Charo plans to expand his business by buying another camera and more film. 


The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. His dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy another camera and more film.

loans.name: Gedion

texts.en:
Gedion is  27 years-old, is married and a father of one child. Gedion owns a barber shop in Bombolulu, Mombasa. He has been in this business for the last eight months and it has been a success.

This marks his first borrowing from KADET LTD to finance his business.He plans to expand his business by purchasing another shaving machine, spirits and after shave. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. His dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: purchase another shaving machine, spirits and after shave.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 41 years old and married. Geoffrey sells fruits and vegetables in Majaoni, Mombasa. His business has been in operation for the last four years and it has been a success. 

This marks his first borrowing from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to expand his business by purchasing more coconuts, potatoes, cabbage, spinach, onions and a variety of fruits.  

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. His dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts, potatoes, cabbage, spinach, onions and a variety of fruits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fruits, carrots, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, potatoes, and coriander.

loans.name: 10.7 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mai has a retail business selling dry food and she has been involved with this business for two years.  She is requesting a loan to purchase rice to resell.

Mai is 36 years old and she is married with one child.
Mai is the group leader of the 10.7 Nam Ngạn solidarity group which consists of three members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Mai's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
The main harship that Mai faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Mai hopes for her business to do well, and to buy a motorbike.  She hopes for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 30 years old and married with three children.  Two of which are in school.  He does mixed farming such as rearing sheep and goats as well as growing wheat.  John has been successful in growing wheat for the past eight years.

He learned about KADET LTD through a KADET staff member.  He is a good client and has applied for his first loan which he plans to spend part in farming and the remaining amount to purchase more animals.

He hopes to make a profit and educate his children.  He also dreams and hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more farming supplies and animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 40 years old and lives in Galingon, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.  She is married with four children.
Myrna's business is cosmetic services and she earns approximately PHP 2000 each month doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of PHP 7000 to purchase equipment for her cosmetic business.  This is Myrna's first year as a member of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her cosmetic business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy 33 years old, is a single mother of one child.  She runs a beauty salon in Kilifi and has been in this business for two years. 

She has been a KADET client, this is her second loan to finance her business. With this loan she plans to purchase inventories of hair food, nail polish, shampoo, conditioner, treatment and relaxer for her beauty salon.

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan, and to gradually expand her business. Her dream is to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: purchase more hair food, nail polish, shampoo, conditioner, treatment and relaxer for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy buy farm inputs like manure, wheat and maize seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric in order to make clothes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare the land for farming and purchase maize seeds.

loans.name: Zebedayo

texts.en:
Zebedayo is 50 years old, married and a father of five children.  Zebedayo is a pool care taker in Nyali, Mombasa. He has been in this business for the last eleven years and it has been a success. 

This marks his first borrowing from KADET LTD to finance his business. Zebedayo plans to expand his business by purchasing cleaning equipments and chemicals for his business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. His dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to purchase pool cleaning equipment and chemicals

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 23 years old.  He is a single man who supports his parents.  He has been a farmer for the last two years.  His farm is in a productive area, which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, with which he is planning to prepare his farm for growing wheat. 

He plans to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming, increase his wheat production and educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land and build a plot.  He is a hard working man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to prepare his farm for wheat planting

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia aims to improve her general store in the village, to satisfy her customers needs and to earn income.  She is a widowed 52 year old, and has four adult children. Being a single parent, it is difficult for her to send the children to college. But she tried her best to support their education until they earned a degree.  She would like to continue managing the business to earn and save for future emergencies and to support the education of her grand children. 

She is requesting an additional capital of P8,000 to buy bread, candy, junk food, beverages, noodles, canned goods and soap for sale in her general store. She works hard and believes that her loan will increase her product offerings and therefore her income. She believes that nothing is impossible for a person who has a strong faith and determination.

loans.use: to buy bread, candy, junk food, beverages, noodles, canned goods and soap  to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Ronkosi

texts.en:
Ronkosi has been farming for the last fifteen  years.  He is 60 years old, married and supports ten people in the family.

He was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff, and he is applying for his second loan. He plans to use this loan amount to buy maize seeds and fertilizer, and also to hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting. 

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in the region.

loans.use: buy maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 40 years old and lives in Bontod, Larena, Siquijor, Philippines.  She is married with four children.

Chona is running a new business of selling rice to earn a living.  Each month, she earns PHP 3,500.00 doing this type of work.   She has requested a loan for 15,000 to purchase more sacks of rice.

Chona has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for eleven months.  In the future, Chona hopes to improve their living conditions and  save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of rice

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick, age 32, is married and they have three children. He has been a wheat farmer for the past seven years.

He learned of KADET through a registered client. He has applied for his first loan from KADET, which he plans to use to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to make a profit and use that profit to purchase sheep for fattening.

He dreams that at the age of 40, he will be stable and his children will live better lives.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Niloberto

texts.en:
Niloberto is 50 years old and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. He is married with three children.

To earn a living, Niloberto has a business producing balot (a boiled, fertilized egg). He earns about 15,000 each month doing this type of work. Niloberto has a requested a loan for 15,000 to purchase 30 trays of eggs to sell 

Niloberto has been a member of PMPC during 2011. In the future, Niloberto would like to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase eggs to sell

location.town: Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a very hard-working woman who practices mixed farming. She has been farming for over five years. She is 31 years old, married, and a mother of three school-going children.

She is applying for her second loan. She plans to use the loan to buy farm inputs. She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. 

She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more ropes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees for his childrren

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en: Jihad is a 23-year-old single man living with his parents and four siblings. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a freelance home electrician since 2008. With his requested loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to purchase new tools needed since he is planning to work on a big project and must be equipped with the necessary tools in order to satisfy the customers’ demands. He feels positive about his business prospects and looks forward to working on multiple electricA. projects in his community.

loans.use: to purchase new tools.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a 37-year-old Lebanese married man and the father of two school-aged children. He has owned a car repair shop since 2000 and has more than 15 years of work experience in the same field. He is specialized in repairing all types of vehicles. Today, he is asking to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase car spare parts with the intention of better serving his clients. He is looking to diversify his business and open a new shop where he can buy and sell car spare parts. His income is needed to help support his wife and two young children.

loans.use: to purchase car spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rosenith

texts.en: Rosenith is married with one child. She is 33 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. To earn a living, Rosenith has a store in the market selling vegetables, spices and eggs. She has had this business for 7 years. Each month, she earns approximately 20000 PHP. She has requested the amount of 25,000 PHP to purchase more stock of vegetables and spices for her store. Rosenith has been a member of PMPC for more than a year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of vegetables and spices for her retail store

loans.name: Dufashanye Group

texts.fr:
Marie est une commerçante âgée de 42ans qui habite  la localité de Nyamugari au centre du pays dans la Province de Gitega. Elle  fait le commerce de tomates, petit pois et du poisson sec appelé « ndagala »depuis 22ans. Elle était marchande ambulante de fruits avant de commencer le présent commerce. Elle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Elle est mariée  a Eric et ont ensemble 8 enfants dont 5 étudient a l’école primaire. 
Le crédit Kiva  de 150,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de tomates,petit pois et poisson sec « ndagala » à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« DUFASHANYE».
texts.en:
Marie, 42,  is a small-scale retailer who lives in Nyamugari in the center of the country in the province of Gitega. She has been selling tomatoes, green peas, and dried fish called "ndagala" for 22 years.  She was a street vendor selling fruit before beginning her current business. She did not go to school. She is married to Eric and they have eight children, of whom five are in primary school. 

The Kiva loan of 150,000 Burundi francs that she will receive will allow her to increase her working capital so as to buy larger quantities of tomatoes, peas, and dried fish for resale so that she can make a good profit. 

She is a member of the community group called "DUFASHANYE".

loans.use: to increase her working capital to buy large quantities of tomatoes, peas, and dried fish  called "ndagala" for resale.

loans.name: Najla

texts.en:
Najla is a 54-year-old Lebanese widow living with her only child. She has been working in the agriculturA. field for the past 16 years. In 1997, she decided to proceed with her business operation independently. So, she bought a plot of land where she started to cultivate vegetables.  

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase fertilizers and seeds in order to increase her business productivity. Najla intends to expand her business with the purpose of earning a higher income to better support her only child.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds in order to increase her business productivity.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen has operated his cereals shop in Naivasha town for the last two years.  He is 52 years old, married to Dorcas, and they have one school-going child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy three  sacks of maize and three sacks of beans to add to his stock for sale.

In future, Stephen hopes to grow his cereals shop and become a leading supplier of cereals in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy three sacks of maize and three  sacks of beans to sell.

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.en:
Cesaria is 50 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She finished her tertiary education but due to the lack of job opportunities she is engaged in selling beauty products in their village to generate income. They want to continue sending their children to school for they want them to become professionals someday. They need to work hard and earn income to cover their needs and finance their education. Sometimes, they experience financial shortages due to the high cost of commodities and school fees. 

In this regard, Cesaria wants to ask for additional capital of P8,000 to buy lotions, deodorants, bath soaps, shampoos and papaya soaps to sell in the village. She believes that this loan will help her to make the business grow. She hopes that her business will become a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy lotions, deodorants, bath soaps, shampoos and papaya soaps to sell in the village.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Pariken

texts.en:
Pariken is 38 years old and married to Helen. They have two children. He has been a farmer for the past nine years. His monthly income is 5,000 KES. Farmers are doing well in his area due to favorable conditions.

He learned about KADET LTD through advertising done by KADET. He has applied for his third loan from KADET, which he plans to use to buy farm supplies. 

He plans to invest the proceeds from the loan back into the farm. He is an honest man who will achieve if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Wassim

texts.en: Wassim is a 36-year-old divorced man from Lebanon. He is living with one parent and a sibling. He has 15 years of experience working as a home electrician. In 1997, he started to work on his own serving clients upon their request. He has two part-time employees helping him since he works in parallel as a calligrapher and must satisfy all his customers' demands. With his requested loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to purchase additional tools and supplies. This will be his first Kiva loan and he is sure that it will allow him to achieve substantial growth in his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and supplies.

loans.name: Kodirjon

texts.ru:
Кодирчон добрый, умный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 2 детей. Более 6 лет Кодирчон занимается выращиванием и продажа сельскохозяйственных культур. Он выращивает картошку, лук и морковь. Его любящая жена и брат помогает ему в данном бизнесе. Кроме этого он занимается скотоводством.  Кодирчон хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить максимальный прибыль с целью улучшения его жилищное условия. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 5800 Сомони для покупки минеральных удобрений, семена, горюче смазочные материалы и скота.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Kodirjon is a kind, smart and goal-oriented person. He is married and the loving father of two. For over six years, Kodirjon has been growing agricultural produce for resale. He grows potatoes, onions and carrots. His loving wife and his brother help him in the business. In addition, he raises farm animals. Kodirjon would like to expand his business and maximize his profit in order to improve his living conditions. He is requesting a loan of 5800 TJS in order to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds, fuel, machine oil and farm animals.

In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.
