Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds, fuel, machine oil and farm animals

loans.name: Micahel

texts.en:
Michael has operated his posho mill (for grinding maize or grain into flour) in Naivasha town for the last three years. He is 23 years old and married to Rebecca. They have one child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD  by one of our field officers, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to add more maize to the inventory in his posho mill shop.

In the future, Michael hopes to own a big posho mill in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy more maize.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad has worked as a taxi driver since 2003. He is a 47-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children who are still attending school. His main service route is between his town and the surrounding areas. Today, Mohamad is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform needed maintenance on his van such as changing wheels and repairing the engine in order to increase its safety features. He notes that he will be able to attract more customers after performing those repairs. In the future, he is planning to purchase a new van and hire a part-time employee to work on it.

loans.use: to perform needed maintenance on his taxi such as changing tires and repairing the engine in order to increase its safety features.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy modern supplies for beekeeping.

loans.name: Twibesheho Group

texts.fr:
Marie Rose est une commerçante âgée de 36ans qui habite  la localité de Ntobwe au centre du pays dans la Province de Gitega. Elle  fait le commerce de bananes et haricots depuis 15ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 7e année des écoles secondaires. Elle est mariée et  mère de 7 enfants dont 5 étudient a l’école primaire. 
Le crédit Kiva  de 100,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de bananes et haricots à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« TWIBESHEHO».
texts.en:
Marie Rose is a small-scale businesswoman of 36 who lives in Ntobwe in the center of the country in the province of Gitega. She has been selling bananas and beans for 15 years. She is also a farmer. She went through primary school. She is married and the mother of seven children of whom five are enrolled in primary school. 

The Kiva loan of 100,000 Burundi francs that she will receive allows her to add to her working capital and buy large quantities of bananas and beans for resale so as to make a lot of profit. 

She is a member of the community group "TWIBESHEHO".

loans.use: to grow her working capital so as to buy large quantities of bananas and beans.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 36 years.  He is 57 years old, married to Milka, and they have seven school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Paul hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  He is 35 years old, married to Ruth, and they have  school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy a new motorbike for transporting his farm produce to the market.

In future, Charles hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for transporting his farm produce to the market.

loans.name: Turamirize Group

texts.fr:
Anitha est une commerçante âgée de 42ans qui habite  dans la zone urbaine de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle  fait le commerce d’articles divers de boutique (riz, haricots, biscuits, savons, bonbons, etc)depuis 21ans. Elle était cultivatrice avant de commencer le présent métier. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaire. Elle est mariée  a Abel et ont ensemble 5 enfants dont 3 étudient  et 2 autres a l’école secondaire. 
Le crédit Kiva  de 550,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités d’articles de boutique(riz, haricots, biscuits, savons, bonbons, etc ) à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  solidaire« TURAMIRIZE».
texts.en:
Anitha is a small-scale retailer of 42 who lives in the urban area of Gitega in the center of the country. She has been selling various shop goods (rice, beans, cookies, bars of soap, candy, etc.) for 21 years. She was a farmer before beginning her current business. She stayed in primary school up to the sixth grade. She is married to Abel and together they have five children of whom three are study and the other two are in secondary school. 

The Kiva loan in the amount of 550,000 Burundi francs that she will receive allows her to add to her working capital so as to buy large quantities of shop goods (rice, beans, cookies, bars of soap, candy, etc.) for resale in order to make a lot of profit. 

She is a member of the solidarity group called "TURAMIRIZE".

loans.use: to add to her working capital to buy large quantities of shop goods (rice, beans, cookies, bars of soap, candy, etc.) for resale.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah has operated her clothes shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years.  She also does small-scale commercial farming on her piece of land.  She is 35 years old and the single mother of one child.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to plant potatoes to sell on her piece of land.

In future, Serah hopes to grow her shop to a big boutique and also become a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: To plant potatoes in her farm to sell.

loans.name: Ensaf

texts.en:
Ensaf is a 49-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and two children. She has established an accounting business over the past 20 years. She works on a freelance basis helping individuals and companies with the reporting process. She helps her husband with the household expenses. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a laptop to better market her services and increase the liquidity of her business. In the future, she is planning to take out another Kiva loan in order to open her own accounting office.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop to better market her services and increase the liquidity of her accounting business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 30-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with one parent and two siblings. He has been working as a car mechanic since 2008 and has 11 years of experience working in similar fields. He has one full-time employee helping him with the work. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase mechanical machinery in order to facilitate his business operation. He notes that this machinery will help him repair  the cars easily. In the future, he is planning to expand his business into other areas.

loans.use: to purchase mechanical machinery in order to facilitate his business operation.

loans.name: Kosimjon

texts.ru:
Косимчон умный, добрый и ответственный человек. Он женат и у них 3 детей. Более 10 лет он занимается ремонта автомобилей дома. Сегодняшний день, зарабатывая денег, он взял в аренду мастерскую там, где он может привлекать много других новых клиентов. Его бизнес идут хорошо и прибыльно. В день он ремонтирует 2-3 автомобилей и получает хорошую прибыль. Его отец и брат плотник и иногда в свободное время Косимчон помогает им. Косимчон хотел бы получить займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки запчастей для ремонта автомобилей. Он  хочет заранее благодарить вас за вашу помощь и поддержку.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Kosimjon is a smart, kind and responsible man. He is married and has three children. He has been repairing vehicles for more than ten years. At this time he has rented out a repair shop where he can attract many new customers and make money. His business is going well and brings profit. He repairs two or three vehicles a day and makes a good profit. His father and brother are carpenters and sometimes in his free time Kosimjon helps them. Kosimjon would like to receive a loan in the amount of $1000USD to buy spare parts to repair vehicles. He wants to thank all of you for your help and support in advance.

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Vaanchigragchaa

texts.en:
Vaanchigragchaa is 59 years old and lives with his wife in a house in Hentii province of Mongolia. His wife helps him to manage the family business and also their children's businesses by selling spare parts while others are away. 

Vaanchigragchaa started his business in 2003 by selling  spare parts for Russian cars. He has many years of business and practical experience. He also has created a regular client base. In other words, he has been in the transportation business for most of his lifetime. 

Currently, he transports goods to business companies. He is a diligent and hard-working man who says "I have been in the transportation business for my lifetime. I can not imagine my life without cars and trucks. For this reason, selling spare parts is very close to my interests and work." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase spare parts.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de 4 femmes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier FARABA de la ville de  BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et augmenter le niveau de leur activité, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela  pour faire le commerce de boissons non alcoolisées et de chaussures à l’image de MAIMOUNA, qui est la première à droite, enfant au pied.
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe et les prêts précédents ont été remboursés correctement. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt MAIMOUNA., compte acheter, de 15 douzaines  de paires de chaussures, auprès des commerçants venant de Bamako. Elle revend  dans son kiosque sis au quartier FARABA de Bougouni, en détail, au comptant à une clientèle diverse et variée.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera utilisée pour rembourser le prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Group Benkadi is composed of four married women, who are on average 43 years old with six children. They live in traditional families. These women reside in the Faraba neighborhood of the city of Bougouni (Mali's third administrative region). They got to know each other through business relations.
In order to satisfy their customers and to grow their business, they decided to join micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso to retail soft drinks and shoes; so does Maimouna, who is the women to the right with a child by her feet. They are on their third group loan, the previous loans having been repaid punctually.
With this new loan, Maimouna is planning on purchasing 15 dozen pairs of shoes from sellers coming from Bamako. She retails cash to a diverse clientele in her kiosk located in the Faraba neighborhood of Bougouni.
With this loan, she is counting on a monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, part of which will be reused to pay back her loan, with the remainder to be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Micheki

texts.en:
Micheki has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 31 years.  He is 51 years old, married to Felista, and they have four school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Micheki hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for planting.

loans.name: Imane

texts.en: Imane is a 38-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four school-aged children. She has 11 years of experience working in selling beauty products and perfumes to local customers. She works from her home where she receives clients. With her requested loan of $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, she will be able to increase her inventory selection of new cosmetics and perfumes in order to increase her sales and therefore her income. She has high hopes for the future of her business and looks forward to opening her own shop in the near future.

loans.use: to increase her inventory selection of new cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is married to a farmer and they live happily in a village with their two children. They cultivate their farm, planting rice and vegetables for sale. These are the main sources of their income.Since their children are now at the college level, they are in need of more financial support. In this regard, they put up a welding shop in their village to generate additional income. 

To provide better service and customers' satisfaction, Leonida wants to ask for an additional capital of P8,000 to buy welding rods, hammers, steel and other welding materials. They believe that this loan will help a lot to strengthen the business. In the future, they are hoping that their business will become viable and profitable to give their children a bright future.

loans.use: to buy welding rods, hammers, steel and other welding materials to provide a better service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mrina

texts.en:
Mrina is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, he has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to his neighbours. He faces a major challenge of high competition from other charcoal sellers in the area. Mrina dreams of expanding his business and establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Composé de cinq femmes  toutes mariées, les membres du groupe Benkadi  ont en moyenne 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Massablacoura dans la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de  parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et augmenter le niveau de leur activité, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela  pour faire le commerce des céréales, chaussures, habits   et avec  RABOUA pour le commerce d’articles divers d’étalage. C’est la seule debout. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe et les quatre prêts précédents ont été remboursés correctement. 
Avec ce  prêt RABOUA, compte acheter 2 sacs de sucre et 2 cartons de cigarettes. Elle s’approvisionne à BOUGOUNI et revend sur son étale au quartier Massablacoura de Bougouni en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera utilisée pour rembourser le prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group consists of five married women who average 40 years of age and four children each. They live in traditional families in the Massablacoura district of the city of BOUGOUNI (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another as neighbors and through ties of kinship. 

They sell cereals, shoes, and clothes. Raboua, seen standing in the photo, sells various display items. Eager to satisfy their customers’ needs and bolster their activities, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their fifth group loan. All previous loans were repaid without incident.

Raboua will use this loan to buy two bags of sugar and two cartons of cigarettes. She gets her stock in Bougouni and sells the merchandise in Massablacoura at retail, for cash or credit, to a client base composed of both men and women.

With this loan, she plans to earn a monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA, which she will use to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase various display items for resale

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a married woman with two children; one attends school while the other one is still too young for school. She lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Valentina dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers demand in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase a sewing machine and cloth materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and cloth.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more raw materials for his shop.

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan is a 44-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and five young children. He has more than 11 years of experience working in the mechanic's field. In 2002, he opened a car repair shop. His work is specialized in repairing vehicles in addition to changing cars' oil. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase needed mechanical equipment. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming year will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: to purchase needed mechanical equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, onions, peppers, and rice.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME est composé de 4 femmes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et 7 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier MASSABLACOURA à BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de  parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et augmenter le niveau de leur activité, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela  pour faire le commerce de tasses et de céréales à l’image de MASSARAN qui est la présidente du groupe et qui tient dans sa main une balaie. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe et les prêts précédents ont  été remboursés correctement. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt MASSARAN, compte acheter, 2 tonnes de riz paddy, auprès des paysans producteurs pour les revendre  en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera utilisée pour rembourser le prêt, aider son mari aux dépenses familiales et le reste  réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Group Djiguisseme is composed of four married women, who are on average 44 years old with 7 children. They live in traditional families. These women reside in the Massablacoura district in Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other through their families and in their neighborhood.
In order to satisfy their customers and to grow their business, they have decided to join micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso to retail containers and cereals. The later is what Massaran, the group's president, does; she is holding a brush in the picture. They are on their third group loan. Previous loans have been punctually repaid.
With this new loan, Massaran is planning on purchasing two tons of paddy rice from farmers to retail (cash or credit) to a clientele composed of resellers and consumers.
With this loan, she is counting on a monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA, part of which will be used to repay the loan and to help her husband with the family's expenses; the remainder will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new oven in order to increase her business productivity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
DJIGUIYA est un regroupement 4 femmes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 3 enfants et vivant dans des familles traditionnelles. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Massablacoura à BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de  parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et augmenter le niveau de leur activité, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela  pour faire le commerce céréales essentiellement. La présidente FATOUMATA est assise en deuxième position à droite, écharpe verdâtre sur la tête.  
Ces femmes du groupe DJIGUIYA sont à leur dixième prêt de groupe et les neufs prêts précédents ont été remboursés  correctement. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt FATOUMATA compte acheter 2 tonnes de céréales, auprès des producteurs à BOUGOUNI pour ensuite les revendre  au de Bougouni en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera utilisée pour rembourser le prêt, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
DJIGUIYA is a group of four married women with an average age of 39 and three children, who live in traditional families. These women reside in the Massablacoura neighborhood of BOUGOUNI, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They met each other because of kinship and neighborhood ties. 

Wishing to satisfy their clientele and improve their businesses, they decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, essentially to work at selling grains. The president, FATOUMATA, is seated second from the right, with a greenish shawl on her head. The women from this group called DJIGUIYA are on their 10th group loan and the nine preceding loans were correctly reimbursed. 

With this new loan, FATOUMATA intends to buy two tons of cereals from the producers in BOUGOUNI to be sold retail at the marketplace of Bougouni, for cash or credit, to a clientele composed of men and women. With this loan she expects to make a monthly profit of 60,000 F CFA of which part will be used to reimburse the loan and contribute to covering family expenses, and the rest reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Armine

texts.en: Armine is engaged in an agricultural business. She has a glasshouse. Besides agriculture, Armine also runs a grocery shop. Armine needs some financial investments to develop her agricultural business. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase seeds and fertilizer. Armine will increase her income and insure better living conditions for her family. Armine lives together with her parents.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mwambeyu

texts.en:
Mwambeyu is a single man who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, he has operated a business selling livestock at the market to his neighbors and passersby. In addition, he also operates a charcoal-selling business, which contributes to his other source of income. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, the availability of customers is lower. He dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000, he wants to purchase goats for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 16 years.  He is 40 years old and married to Esther.  They have 3 children who all attend school.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and on time.  He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Bernard hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds needed to increase his business productivity and to pay his only employee’s salary.

loans.name: Amankeldi

texts.en:
Amankeldi is 45 years old and lives with his four children and wife in a ger,  a traditional Mongolian yurt in the  Bayan-Olgii province of Mongolia. His children go to high school. Currently his wife is unemployed. 
 
He started his business in 1997 by transporting goods and people. Since then, he has been continuously transporting. He has many years of business and practical experience. He is planning to replace his current car with a new one. 

Amankeldi's daily income is between 50,000 and 100,000 MNT. He is a hard-working and diligent man who says "I am doing my best to build this life and make a good life for my family." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase spare parts for his car.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a single man who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his extended family.

Bakari operates charcoal-selling business, selling at the market to his neighbors. His major challenge is seasonality. During the rainy season, charcoal is less available to sell in rural areas. He dreams of establishing a boutique shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, he wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes qui composent le groupe SABALI ont une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 6 enfants et vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Massablacoura à BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parentés et de leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et augmenter le niveau de leur activité, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela  pour faire le commerce de condiments alimentaires, du bois de chauffe et de céréales.   
MAIMOUNA, qui est la présidente du groupe, la deuxième à gauche qui tient une puisette dans la main, elle excelle dans le commerce des céréales. Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt de groupe et les prêts précédents ont été remboursés correctement. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt MAIMOUNA, compte acheter 2,5 tonnes de riz de différentes sortes, auprès des producteurs pour revendre  au quartier MASSABLACOURA de Bougouni en détail, au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera utilisée pour rembourser le prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
This seven women who make up this group called SABALI have an average age of 43, six children, and live mainly in traditional families. These women reside in the Massablacoura neighborhood in BOUGOUNI, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They met because of kinship and through their businesses. 

Wishing to satisfy their clientele and grow their businesses, they decided to join the Micro-finance Institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to sell condiments, firewood, and cereals. The women are on their ninth group loan and the preceding loans were correctly reimbursed. 
  
MAIMOUNA, who is the president of the group, second from the left, holding a water dipper in her hands, excels in selling grains. With this new loan she intends to buy 2.5 tons of rice of various sorts, from the producers, to be sold in the MASSABLACOURA area of Bougouni, retail and for cash, to a clientele composed of men and women. With this loan she hopes to make a monthly profit of 60,000 F CFA  of which part will be used to reimburse the loan and the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Twiteriteka Group

texts.fr:
Delphine est une commerçante âgée de 43ans qui habite  dans la localité de Rutoki au centre du Burundi dans la Province de Gitega. Elle  fait le commerce de bananes depuis 3ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice.Elle n’a  pas fréquenté l’école. Elle est mariée  a Stanislas et ont ensemble 7 enfants dont 3 sont  a l’école primaire. 
Le crédit Kiva  de 150,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter une grande quantité de bananes  à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« TWITERITEKA»
texts.en: Delphine is a 43-year-old shop keeper who lives in the town of Rutoki in the center of Burundi in the Gitega Province. She has been in the trade of bananas for 3 years. She is also a farmer. She did not attend school. She is married to Stanislas and they have 7 children together 3 of which are in elementary school. The Kiva loan of 150,000 francs burundais that she will obtain will allow her to increase her capital in order to buy a large quantity of bananas to resell in order to realize a large profit. She is a member of the Community group "TWITERITEKA".

loans.use: To increase her capital to buy a large quantity of bananas to resell in order to realize a large profit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane runs a grocery shop. She would like to increase the variety of goods to meet her clients' demand. With the requested loan, Gayane plans to purchase more goods to sell. Gayane will increase her working capital and expand her business in the future. With additional income, Gayane will be able to ensure a better future for her family. Gayane lives with her husband and her little child.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell.

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Isaiah, 31 years old, has practiced small-scale commercial farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years.    

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Isaiah hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jaka

texts.en:
Jaka is 39 years old and lives in Bardnersville.  She ended her education in the 9th grade.  She is married and has children between 5 to 15 years old in school who live with her at home.

For the past three years, Jaka has been selling hair and clothes.  She is requesting a loan to purchase hair and clothes for her business. The problem she is facing with her business is a shortage of goods.  She started this business with money that her husband gave her, and she learned the business from a friend.  Jaka enjoys her business because of the way that people respond to it, and because of how fast it is growing.  She plans to expand her business, send her children to school, and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase hair and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Urangua

texts.en:
Urangua is 45 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Govisumber province of Mongolia. Her two eldest children studied at the university; the other two are living with her. Her husband works at the local train station. 

Urangua used to work as an administrative officer at the local government office of Sumber soum until 2010. Then she started her business by selling meat and dairy products at the Naran local market. Her husband's relatives are herders in the countryside and supply her with meat and dairy products. She and her husband are loyal customers of XacBank and have received many loans. She is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat and to expand her business and increase her capital turnover.

loans.use: To purchase more meat and to expand her business

loans.name: Grigor

texts.en: Grigor keeps livestock and an orchard and cultivates land. Agriculture is the family's main source of income, but it is not enough to cover their daily costs. With the requested loan Grigor plans to purchase fuel and seeds. With the help of this loan Grigor will successfully cultivate the land and develop agriculture. This will help him to insure better living conditions for his family. Grigor lives together with his wife and two sons.

loans.use: to pay for fuel and seeds

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  He is 46 years old and married to Grace.  They have three children who attend school.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and on time.  He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, John hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi, 44 years old, has been a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years. She is separated from her husband and now takes care of their two children, who are both in college.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Naomi hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan works at the local school as a chess teacher. Unfortunately, a teacher's salary is too low to make ends meet. 

Vardan is also engaged in farming. Vardan would like to increase his herd and develop his land. With the requested loan, he plans to purchase livestock and forage. 

Agricultural development will help Vardan increase his income and ensure a brighter future for his family. Vardan lives with his parents and grandmother.

loans.use: to pay for livestock and forage.

loans.name: Swalehe

texts.en:
Swalehe is a married man with eleven children; six attend school while five are still young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past eleven years, he has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business. His potential customers are town dwellers and neighbours. Swalehe also operates a charcoal-selling business which contributes to his other source of income. He dreams of establishing a real estate business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase spare parts to service his motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Na'eema

texts.en:
Na'eema is a 59-year-old woman. She is married and has four sons and one daughter. She lives in Rafah city in Gaza located in Palestine. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee who gets a modest salary. 

Na'eema has her own project, that is, sewing clothes. She wants to purchase a new sewing machine instead of the old one to improve the quality of clothes she tailors and so increase the family income. The amount of money Na'eema has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $1,500 from FATEN.

When Na'eema gets her FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will purchase a new sewing machine and be able to improve the quality of clothes she tailors. That will increase her income and lead to improving her family's life. Na'eema is photographed working at her project, next to the sewing machine she wants to replace with a new one.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine to improve the quality of clothes she tailors.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SOUTOURA est composé de 4 femmes mariées et d’une veuve, qui ont en moyenne 34 ans, 5 enfants et qui vivent dans des familles nucléaires. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Massablacoura à BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de  parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et augmenter le niveau de leur activité, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela  pour faire le commerce de savons, d’habits, de chaussures, de bois de chauffe etc. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe et le prêt précédent a été remboursé correctement. 
La présidente BINTOU est assise devant les autres membres s’est spécialisée dans l’achat vente de savons de toutes sortes. Avec ce prêt BINTOU compte acheter, 4  cartons de savons de fabrication moderne. 
Elle s’approvisionne à BOUGOUNI pour ensuite les revendre  dans le quartier Massabla coura en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera utilisée pour rembourser le prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
The group SOUTOURA is composed by four married women and a widow, who are in average 34 years of age, have five children and live in nuclear families. These women live in the neighborhood of  Massablacoura in BOUGOUNI (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They are related through family and neighborhood ties .
In order to satisfy their customers demand and increase the level of their activity, they decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and get into the business of trading with soaps, clothes, shoes, firewood, etc. This is their second group loan and the previous one was punctually repaid. 
Bintou, the president of the group, is sitting in front of the other members; she is specialized in sale and purchase of soaps of all kinds. With this loan Bintou is buying four boxes of modern manufacturing soap.
She gets her supplies in BOUGOUNI and then resells them in the district of Massablacoura, detailing, cash and credit, to male and female customers.
With this loan she plans to achieve a monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, part of which will be used to repay the loan and the rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase drinks for resale.

loans.name: Shida

texts.en:
Shida is a married man with four children, two attend school while the other two are still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, he has operated a retail shop, selling at the market to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. Shida dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan he wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, paraffin and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, paraffin and sugar.

loans.name: Nune

texts.en:
Nune is engaged in an agricultural business. She would like to start growing flowers in her glasshouse and expand her business. With the requested loan, Nune plans to purchase flower seeds.

With the help of this loan, Nune will increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. Nune lives together with her husband, two sons and mother-in-law.

loans.use: to pay for flower seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ramatou

texts.fr:
Madame Ramatou est une femme mariée de 32 et mère d’un enfant qui réside avec son époux et son enfant dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquentée l’école pour des raisons sociales, dès son jeune âge elle commença les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa mère qui faisant le commerce d’articles divers. Après quelques d’expériences auprès de cette dernière
 Ramatou opta pour les activités d’achat et de vente de légumes (tels les laitue, les concombres), de tubercules ( tels les ignames) et de fruits (tels les bananes plantains). Elle mène cette activité au grand marché de Bougouni. Avec une expérience de plus de 10 années, elle maîtrise bien son activité et est très sollicitée.
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son deuxième prêt après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt.
Ramatou compte acheter, 500 kg d’ignames et trois  chargements de charrettes en régime de bananes plantains. Elle s’approvisionne à Bougouni et à Sikasso auprès des forains en provenance de la Côte d’Ivoire. Elle revend  au grand marché de Bougouni, à une clientèle diverse et variée.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer au dépenses de la famille et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ramatou is a 32-year-old married woman and the mother of one child who lives with her husband and child in the Hérémakono district north of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

Not having attended school for social reasons, at a young age, she started her income-generating activities with her mother who is in the business of sundries. After some experience with that, Ramatou opted for the business of buying and selling vegetables (such as lettuce and cucumbers), tubers (such as yams) and fruits (such as plantain bananas). She conducts her business at the grand market of Bougouni. 

With the experience of 10 years, she has mastered her business and is in great demand. In order to satisfy her growing number of customers, she decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso with which she is on her second loan having properly repaid the first loan. Ramatou intends to buy 500 kg of yams and three cartloads of plantain bananas. She stocks up in Bougouni and in Sikasso with the stallkeepers from the Ivory Coast. She resells in the grand market of Bougouni to a diverse and varied clientele. With the loan, she intends to make a monthly profit of 65,000 FCFA which will be used to contribute to family expenses and the rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy general products

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith has operated her restaurant in Naivasha town for the last two years. She is 37 years old, married to Francis and they have one child.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy new tables and seats for her restaurant.

In future, Edith hopes to grow her restaurant and open many branches in town.

loans.use: To buy new seats and tables for her restaurant.

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en: Nelli is engaged in the agricultural business. She keeps livestock and cultivates land. Nelly would like to start cultivating eggplant and expand her business. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase eggplant seeds. With the loan's help, Nelli will develop agriculture and get more income. This will allow her to renovate the barn in the future and also to improve her family's living conditions. Nelli lives together with her son, daughter-in-law and two children.

loans.use: to pay for eggplant seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is 29 years old and a mother of two boys. Her husband Haroon is an employee at one of the Jordanian universities.

Sabah wanted to help her husband and her family financially, but at the same time she doesn’t want to be away from her children so she started a small home business selling stationery items, accessories and cosmetics. 

Now Sabah has applied for a loan to buy a wrapping machine so she can make special sets of the items she sells on her own.

loans.use: To buy a wrapping machine.

loans.name: Azamat

texts.ru:
Азамат очень хороший и порядочный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур более 11 лет и у него очень богатый опыт по данному бизнесу. В основном он выращивает арбуз и дыню, а потом продает на выгодную цену. Его жена и дети помогает ему на переработки земли и посева семена. Азамат хотел бы получить займ в размере 8000 Сомони для покупки семена, минеральных удобрений, горюче смазочные материалы, оплата труда тракториста и рабочей силы. Он заранее хочет благодарить вас за вашу помощь и поощрения.  


 More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Azamat is a very good and decent man. He is married and the loving father of 3 children. He has cultivated crops for more than 11 years and has extensive experience in this line of work. He mainly grows watermelon and melon and then sells them for a profit. His wife and children help him prepare the land and plant seeds. Azamat is requesting a loan of 8000 somoni to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants, and to pay for tractor drivers work and other manpower. He wishes to thank you in advance for your help and encouragement.

 More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Buy seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants and pay for the labor of tractor operators and other manpower.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cement to sell in his shop

loans.name: Alla

texts.en: Alla runs a hairdressing salon. She has been successfully running this business for past few years. Alla would like to renovate the salon's interior and provide services with more quality for her clients. With the requested loan, Alla plans to pay for the salon's renovation. An increase of the services' quality will help Alla meet her clients' demand and also attract new ones. Alla will increase her income and ensure a more stable future for her family. Alla lives together with her husband and two children.

loans.use: to pay for the salon's renovation.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Native de Sikasso et âgée de 29 ans, Fatoumata est une divorcée et mère de deux garçons. Elle vit dans une grande traditionnelle élargie à Médine- Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, Fatoumata s’est initiée  à cette activité d’achat et de vente d’articles d’alimentation depuis plus de cinq années. Elle mène son activité devant son domicile à Médine, Sikasso, où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de deux années et elle a déjà bénéficié de trois prêts qui ont été remboursés avec succès.
Ainsi, elle sollicite un quatrième prêt pour acheter auprès de ses fournisseurs de Sikasso mais aussi de Bamako,  45 paquets de boissons NBB, 50 casiers de boissons BRAMALI, 72 cartons d’eau minérale, 10 cartons de lait Candia, 32 cartons de boisson en canette de différentes qualités (Malta, Vimto, Ivorio, etc), 17 paquets d’eau minérale en sachets, des cartons de biscuits de qualité différentes, etc.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 350 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
A native of Sikasso and 29-years-old, Fatoumata is a divorcée and the mother of two boys. She lives in a large traditional extended area of Médine- Sikasso (third administrative region of the republic of Mali). 

After having conducted many businesses without success, Fatoumata started in the business of buying and selling groceries more than five years ago. She conducts her business in front of her home in Médine, Sikasso, where she is sought after by her customers for the quality of her products. 

To satisfy her growing number of customers, she decided to rejoin the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso more than two years ago and she has already received three loans which have been successfully repaid. Thus, she requests a fourth loan in order to buy from the suppliers from Sikasso and also from Bamakano, 45 packets of NBB beverages, 50 cases of BRAMALI drinks, 72 cartons of mineral water, 10 cartons of Candia milk, 32 cartons of different kinds of canned drinks (Malta, Vimto, Ivorio, etc.), 17 packages of mineral water in pouches, boxes of different types of biscuits, etc.

With this loan, she plans to make a monthly profit of 350,000 FCFA which will essentially be used to cover her family expenses, to pay the loan interest and to invest the rest in the business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Nivyiza Group

texts.fr:
Jean est un commerçant âgé de 57ans qui habite  la localité de Nyabitanga au centre du pays dans la Province de Gitega. Il  fait le commerce de bananes depuis 10ans. Il est aussi cultivateur et éleveur de chèvres et de vaches. Il a fréquenté l’ecole jusqu’en 6e annee primaire. Il est marie et père de 5enfants qui étudient avec dont 2 à l’école primaire.  
Le crédit Kiva  de 120,000 francs burundais qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de bananes à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« NIVYIZA».
texts.en: Jean is a 57-year-old shop keeper who lives in the town of Nyabitanga in the center of the country in the Gitega Province. He has been in the banana business for 10 years. He is also a farmer and a breeder of goats and cows. He attended school until the 6th year of elementary school. He is married and the father of 5 children who are in school with 2 in elementary school. The Kiva loan of 120,000 burundi francs that he is obtaining will allow him to increase his capital to buy large quantities of bananas to resell in order to realize large profits. He is a member of the community group "NIVYIZA".

loans.use: to increase his capital in order to buy large quanitites of bananas to resell in order to realize large profits

loans.name: Rokia

texts.fr:
Née à Bamako il y’a 27 ans, Rokia est mariée et mère d’un garçon. Elle vit avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une grande traditionnelle élargie à Médine Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, Rokia s’est initiée depuis plus de dix années  à cette activité d’achat et de vente d’articles d’alimentation. Elle mène son activité devant son domicile à Médine Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ une année.
Après un premier prêt remboursé sans aucune difficulté, elle sollicite un deuxième pour acheter auprès de ses fournisseurs de Sikasso mais aussi de Bamako, 30 paquets de boisson NBB, 70 casiers de boisson BRAMALI, 50 cartons d’eau minérale, 20 cartons de lait Candia, 60 cartons de boisson canette différentes (Malta, Vimto, Ivorio, etc), 20 paquets d’eau minérale en sachets, 15 cartons de biscuits de qualité différentes, etc.
Avec ce deuxième prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in Bamako and 27-years-old, Rokia is married and the mother of a son. She lives with her husband and their children in a large traditional extended area of Médine Sikasso (third administrative region of the republic of Mali). 

After having carried on many businesses without success, Rokia started about ten years ago in the business of buying and selling grocery store items. She conducts her business outside her home in Médine Sikasso where she is sought after by her customers for the quality of her products. 

In order to satisfy her growing number of customers, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about a year ago. After repaying her first loan without much difficulty, she seeks a second in order to buy from the suppliers of SIkasso and also from Bamako, 30 packets of NBB beverages, 70 cases of BRAMALI drinks, 50 cartons of mineral water, 20 cartons of Candia milk, 60 boxes of different canned drinks (Malta, Vimto, Ivorio, etc.), 20 packages of mineral water in pouches, 15 cartons of different types of biscuits, etc.

With the second loan, she plans to make a monthly profit of 300,000 FCFA which will essentially be used to contribute to family expenses, to pay the interest on her loan and to invest the rest in her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children; two attend school while three have graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a meat goat selling business; she sells at the market to her neighbours and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity in her area of operation. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 40 years old and lives in Bardnersville. He is married with two children aged 4 and 18 years old. They are both attending school and doing well with their studies. For the past six years John has been selling cement in his community. He make a lot of money especially during the rainy season. He is requesting a loan to purchase more cement for his business. He plans to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more cement for his business.

loans.name: Nurgizar

texts.en:
Nurgizar is 54 years old and lives with her three children and husband in  a 'ger', a Mongolian yurt, in Bayan-Olgii province of Mongolia. Her husband works as a musician at the local cultural house. Her family moved to the new town about 6 months ago and is now building a new house. 

Nurgizar started her business about 16 years ago. Her business working capital totals 1,000,000 MNT. Currently there is a high demand for meat because many students are coming to the town. 

Nurgizar has a good sense of business and good decision-making ability. She says "I want to expand my business and increase my sales income. I also have a good imagination of my future." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase meat for the business.

loans.use: To purchase meat.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a married woman with eight children; four attend school while four are married. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During rainy season the availability of charcoal is low compared to high demand. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Khoren

texts.en: Khoren is engaged in the agricultural business. He lives with his wife and two sons, one of whom is presently in the army. Agriculture is the family's main source of income, but it is barely enough to make ends meet. Khoren would like to obtain more livestock and develop his agricultural business. With the requested loan, he plans to purchase livestock. Khoren will expand his business and increase his income, ensuring a better future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Natella

texts.en: Natella works at the local kindergarden as a nurse. She is also engaged in farming, cultivates land and keeps a glasshouse. Natella would like to develop agriculture and expand her business. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase seeds and pigs. With the help of this loan, Natella will increase her working capital and improve her family's living conditions. Natella lives together with her husband and three children.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and pigs.

loans.name: Viktorya

texts.en: Viktorya is engaged in farming. Viktorya's husband has passed away, and it is very hard for her to care for her two little children all alone. Viktorya would like to increase the livestock and develop agriculture. With the requetsed loan, Viktorya plans to purchase livestock and forage. Development of agriculture will help Viktorya to increase her income, which means a brighter future for her children.

loans.use: to pay for livestock and forage.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rhoda is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a business buying and selling goats at the market and from home. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her area of operation. Rhoda dreams of expanding her business and establishing a butcher shop in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: Erik

texts.en: Erik is engaged in beekeeping. He would like to increase the number of beehives and develop his business further. With the requested loan Erik plans to purchase beehives. Development of beekeeping will help Erik increase his income and insure a better life for his parents and his future family.

loans.use: to pay for beehives.

loans.name: Mobil

texts.ru: Mabil 20 let. On nejnat. Mobil yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Kalbadjar seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoim bratom. On seychas nujdayetysa v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit masla dlya prodaji, uvelichiv svoy tovar on xochet razvit svoy bizness. Mobil uje qod kak zanimayetsya prodajey raznix masel dlya mashin ( mmatornoye, tormoznoye i t.d maslo)
texts.en: Mabil is 20 years old and single.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Kalbadjar and now lives in the Absheron region together with his brother.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy oil for sale.  Having increased his merchandise quantity, he wants to develop his business.  Mobil has been involved in selling various types of automotive oils (engine, brake, etc.) for one year.

loans.use: to buy oil for sale

loans.name: Ayi Koffi

texts.fr:
Ayi  est  un homme âgé de 36 ans. Il est célibataire. Il  n’a pas encore d’enfants.  
Ayi  est proprietaire d’un cafétariat  depuis 2001. Il vend à toutes personnes dans son kiosque. Il travaille avec une personne de sa famille.
Ayi  a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits nécessaires à son activité de restauration. Il veut aussi monter une activité parallèle à son cafétariat. 
Dans les prochaines années, Ayi  voudrait agrandir son cafétariat. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de se marier et avoir un foyer.
texts.en: Ayi is a 36-year-old man. He is single. He doesn't have any children yet. Ayi has been the owner of a cafeteria since 2001. He sells to the public in his booth. He works with a person from his family. Ayi has requested his second loan from WAGES in order to buy the necessary products for his restaurant business. He also wants to set up a parallel business to his cafeteria. In the coming years, Ayi would like to grow his cafeteria. He says, with the profits, he plans to marry and to have a home.

loans.use: to buy general grocery products

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit is a tailor. She has been running the business successfully for more than ten years. Anahit needs new equipment to increase the quality of the finished products. Anahit will serve her clients better and expand her business which will improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for new equipment.

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a poultry business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a tailoring business which forms her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity in her area of operation. She dreams of expanding her poultry business in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase more chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en: Davit is a doctor. Unfortunately his salary is too low to cover the family's daily costs. So Davit also cultivates land and keeps livestock. Davit needs some financial investments to cultivate the land. With the requested loan Davit plans to pay purchase forage and fertilizer. With the help of this loan Davit will develop his business and get more income. Additional income means improved living conditions for Davit and his family. Davit lives together with his wife, two daughters and mother-in-law.

loans.use: to pay for forage and fertilizer.

loans.name: Abdurauf

texts.ru:
Абдурауф честный и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Абдурауф  занимается выращиванием картошки, пшеницу и других сельскохозяйственных культур. Он также занимается откормом скотов. Абдурауф встает рано утро и уходит из дома на свою землю, чтобы перерабатывать и поливать землю и кормит своего скота. Он любить свой бизнес, и хочет расширить его. По данному бизнесу помогает ему его жена и дети. Он очень хочет, чтобы его дети выросли хорошими и образованными людьми и с этой целью он идет вперед и работает усердно.  Абдурауф хотел бы получить займ в размере 2000$ США для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Abdurauf is an honest and hard-working person.  He is married and is a loving father of three children.  Abdurauf is involved in growing potatoes, wheat and various other agricultural crops.  He is also involved in raising livestock.  Abdurauf  gets up early in the morning and leaves his house to work on his land in order to treat and water the land and feed his livestock.  He loves his business and wants to expand it.  His wife and children help him in this business.  He very much wants his children to grow up to become good and educated people, and he moves ahead and works hard to achieve this goal.  Abdurauf wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2000 to purchase livestock to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Lusvard

texts.en: Lusvard works as a teacher at the local school.  She is also engaged in agriculture. Nonetheless her main income comes from agriculture. Lusvard grows different sorts of fruits and sells them at the city market. In season, fresh fruit is in big demand. So Lusvard would like to buy fruits in bulk to sell in the winter. Lusvard will increase her income and develop her business further. Additional income will help Lusvard to improve her family's living conditions. She lives together with her husband.

loans.use: to pay for fruits.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 26-year-old young man, who is married and has one son. Ahmad owns a barber shop and he wants to purchase a barber kit in order to improve his service for his customers. Ahmad has not enough money to pay for a new barber kit, so he needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Ahmad takes the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will pay easily to purchase a new barber kit and serve his customers better and so work extra to increase his income. Ahmad is photographed in the barber shop he owns.

loans.use: To purchase a barber kit in order to improve the quality of his service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase organic seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more seasonal clothes to increase income.

loans.name: Mensah Georges

texts.fr:
Georges est un homme âgé de 28 ans. Il est marié å une blanchisseuse. Il a 2 enfants, dont 1 à l’école. Le premier a 5 ans et le dernier a 2 ans.  
Georges travaille comme couturier brodeur depuis 1999. Il achete des tissus et confectionne des habits avec broderies pour les vendre à ses clients dans sa boutique. Il travaille avec sa femme parfois dans son commerce. En ce moment, il manque de capitaux pour faire grandir son commerce. 
Georges a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter d’acheter des tissus pour confectionner des habits. Il veut réinjecter les profits dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Georges voudrait agrandir son atelier. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Georges is a 28-year-old man. He is married to a laundress. He has 2 children one of which is in school. The oldest is 5 years old and the youngest is 2 years old. Georges has worked as an embroidered dressmaker since 1999. He buys fabric and creates clothing with embroidery to sell to his customers in his boutique. He works with his wife in his business. At this moment, he lacks the capital to grow his business. Geroges has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy some fabric to create clothing. He wants to reinvest the profits in his business. In the coming years, Georges would like to grow his work shop. He says, with the profits, he plans to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy fabric to create clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry and organic seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice has operated her retail shop in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the last two years.  She is 43 years old, married to Joram, and has three school-going children.  She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers. This will be her third loan; she paid her previous loans back in good time.  She plans to use the money to buy more goods to sell in her retail shop.  In the future, Beatrice hopes to grow her retail shop and move into wholesale.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Floriana

texts.en:
Floriana is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school.  She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past eight years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling to her neighbours and to passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her biggest dream is to expand and purchase another machine in the future.

With the KES 20,000 Floriana wants to purchase cloth for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees for her 2 children in high school

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is a hard-working woman who is married and has one child. For five years, she has been engaged in a farming business and cultivates fruits and vegetable crops. Gulshan is the main breadwinner, considering that her husband works as a construction workman and his monthly salary is 70 USD.  The income she gains is about 250 USD per month. In this business her husband helps her in order to improve their standard of living.

The income she earns from this business allows her to take care of her family. Gulshan needs to buy seeds and organic fertilizer. Gulshan would like to get a loan of 1000 AZN for purchasing fertilizer for her land, which can allow her to get a good harvest. It is the first loan that she has requested and she hopes that lenders will support her.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en: Gideon has practiced farming in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the last 20 years.  He is 54 years old, married to Ruth, and has three school-going children.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the money to buy a dairy cow to increase his milk production.  In the future, Gideon hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul has practiced farming in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the last 2 years.  He is 50 years old, married to Warigia, and has four school-going children.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the money to buy a dairy cow, and hopes to increase his production of milk to sell.  In the future, Paul hopes to become one of the leading farmers and suppliers of milk and milk products in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Muso

texts.ru:
Мусо умный, целеустремленный и добросовестный человек. Он женат и у них один любимый ребенок. Он старается содержит свою семью в хороших условиях жизни и он хочет чтобы его ребенок вырос здоровым и был всегда счастливым. Более 7 лет он занимается услугами таксиста, он любить свою профессию и с удовольствием занимается этим. Он всегда старается, чтобы его клиенты были довольны. Мусо запрашивает займ для покупки нового автомобиля с целью расширения бизнеса. Он очень надеется, что кредиторы будут поддерживать его, и он заранее хочет поблагодарить всех кредиторов за их поддержку и милосердие. Спасибо! 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Muso is a smart, goal-oriented and conscientious person.  He is married and has one loved child.  Muso tries to provide good living conditions for his family and wants his child to grow up healthy and always be happy.  He has been providing a taxi service for seven years and loves his business and does it with satisfaction.  Muso tries to make sure that his customers are happy.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of a new car in order to expand his business.  He hopes that the creditors will support him and wants to thank all creditors in advance for the support and mercy.  Thank you!

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
