Getrude is a married woman with two children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, Getrude has operated a retail shop, selling items to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of theft because of lack of security in her area of operation. Her major goal is to expand her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 40,000, Getrude wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and soap detergent. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and soap detergent.

loans.name: Akouvi  Enyonam

texts.fr:
Akouvi est une femme  âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée å un agent de voyage. Elle a 02 enfants, dont 1 à l’école. Le premier a 25 ans et le dernier a 16 ans.  
Akouvi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2000. Elle achète et revend des poissons pour ses clients à la maison, au marché ou parfois de façon ambulante. Elle est seule impliquée dans son commerce. En ce moment, sa difficulté principale est qu’elle ne dispose pas de moyens de transport. 
Akouvi a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des poissons. Elle veut investir les  profits supplémentaires dans la vente de céréales. 
Dans les prochaines années, Akouvi voudrait disposer d’un moyen de transport pour convoyer facilement ses marchandises. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit aider son enfant à poursuivre ses études.
texts.en:
Akouvi, age 40, is married to a travel agent. She has two children, out of whom one attends school. One is 25, the other is 16.

She's been working as a reseller since 2000. She buys and sells fish for her customers at her home, at the market, and sometimes door-to-door. She's working alone. At this time, her main challenge is the lack of a mean of transportation. 

Akouvi is seeking her second loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy fish. She wants to invest the additional profits into selling cereals. In the forthcoming years, she would like to have a vehicle to transport her goods more easily. She says that with her profits, she intends to help her child to pursue his studies.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Ganima

texts.ru: Ganima zamujem i imeyet 4 detey. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Lachin, seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Ganima 57 let. Ona uje 9 qoda kak zanimayetsya prodajey raznix soleniy. Seychas ona nudjayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit soleni dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Ganima is married and has four children.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Lachin and now lives in the Absheron region together with her family.  Ganima is 57 years old.  She has been involved in selling various marinated goods for nine years.  Currently, she needs 2000 AZN in order to buy marinated goods for sale.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a restaurant business; her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, and also theft because of lack of security in her area of operation. She dreams of expanding her restaurant in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 30,000, Mary wants to purchase food for the restaurant business. She decided to join Yehu because of its favorable lending terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase food for the restaurant business.

loans.name: Vigilance

texts.en:
Vigilance is a married woman with one child who has already graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, Vigilance has operated a motor vehicle business, and travelers are her potential customers. In addition, she also operates a cereals shop business that contributes to her other source of income. Vigilance faces a major challenge of theft because of lack of security in her area of operation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 40,000, Vigilance wants to service her motor vehicle and purchase cereals for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to service her motor vehicle and purchase cereals for resale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a Palestinian young man who is married and has two sons. He lives in Beddya village near Nablus city in Palestine. Ahmad has a carpentry workshop and he wants to improve the quality of the parts he manufactures like parts of home furniture. But Ahmad does not have enough money to pay, so he needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Ahmad gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will pay easily to purchase the carpenter kit he needs to improve his work and increase his income so the family can live in better conditions. Ahmad is photographed in his carpentry workshop.

loans.use: To purchase a new carpenter kit to improve his work.

loans.name: Mirtelman

texts.ru: Mirtelman uje 2 goda imeyet svoy proguktoviy magazin. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Mirtelman 28 let. On jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoim bratom. Seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit produkti dlya pereprodaji. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilsya u svoyego starshego brata kotoriy toje zanimayetsya etim biznessam
texts.en: Mirtelman has owned a food store for two years.  He is not married and does not have children.  Mirtelman is 28 years old.  He lives in the Absheron region together with his brother.  Currenlty, he needs 2000 AZN to buy products for resale.  He learned this business from his older brother, who is also involved in this business.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 57-year-old married man. He is a father of three children, and has worked as a blacksmith since 25 years ago.

Hussein is an expert in his field; he is a hard worker who devotes his whole life for the sake of his family and business. Hussein improves himself and his work a lot; he works hard on it all the time, especially through updating his tools and machines used. That's why he requested a loan from Al Majmoua to buy new tools necessary to make his work easy and with good quality.

Hussein has been an Al Majmoua borrower for two consecutive loan cycles, with a good history. He has a good quality of work with the best price given. Hussein is also going to help his son with building his house. 

He hopes he can expand his shop more in the future to take more requested projects.

loans.use: To buy new tools necessary for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy diapers

loans.name: Wendbingda Group

texts.fr:
Mme Pauline est la représentante du groupe WENDBINGDA. Elle est marie et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 19ans et le moins âgé a 15ans. Les 02 vont à l’école. Elle a 02 personnes en charge.

Elle fait le jardinage et vend des légumes depuis 15ans. Son approvisionnement dans une boutique au secteur 10. Ses clients sont les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter, 01 sac d’engrais, 02 sachets de semence en salade, 01sachet en choux et 01 sachet en menthe.

Mme économise  pour  de la famille et de la scolarité. Elle ambitionne assurer l’éducation  de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pauline is the representative of the group WENDBINGDA. She is married and the mother of two dependent children. The oldest is 19 years old and younger one is 15. Both children attend school. 

Mrs. Pauline started keeping a garden and selling vegetables 15 years ago. She buys her supplies in a shop located in Sector 10. Her customers are women.

She wants to buy one sack of fertilizer, two small bags of lettuce seed, one small bag of cabbage seed and one small bag of mint seed.

Ms. Pauline saves to help provide for her family and her children’s tuition. She plans to support their education

loans.use: to buy one sack of fertilizer, two small bags of lettuce seed, one small bag of cabbage seed and one small bag of mint seed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 28 years old and a hard-working single man. He has been working as a plumber for eight years now. Since he is an ambitious person, he was able to open his own store for selling plumbing tools and other types of tools. Now Ali has applied for this loan to add more products to his store and to make a sign for his store.

loans.use: To design and hang a sign for his tool shop and buy more products to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.fr:
Joseph  est motard et il est client d’ACB depuis 2009. Il est né au Rwanda et a 37 ans. Il est marié et il a 5 enfants de 2 à 15 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. 
C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter une moto et ses accessoires destinent au transport.
 Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’acheter d’autres motos pour augmenter la capacité de son affaire. Dans les prochaines années, Joseph voudrait bâtir une autre maison d’habitation. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants
texts.en: Joseph is a biker and he has been a client of ACB since 2009. He was born in Rwanda and is 37 years old. He is married and he has 5 children from 2 to 15 years old, including 4 in school. It is his third lending cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy a motorcycle and accessories intended for transport. His strategy for the growth of his business is to buy other motorcycles to grow the capacity of his business. In the coming years, Joseph would like to build another house. With the profits, he plans to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle and accessories intended for transport

loans.name: Abduahad

texts.ru:
С ранних лет Абдуахад интересовался  выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур и скотоводством. Он всегда мечтал иметь свою собственную землю и много скотов, чтобы создать свою ферму. Он выращивает картошку, пшеницу и ячмень для корма своих скотов. Более 7 лет он занимается этим и старается расширить его. Он женат и любящий отец 5 детей.  Прибыль, который он получает от данного бизнеса, он тратят для нужды своей семьи и расширения бизнеса. Абдуахад хотел бы получит кредит в размере 3000$ США для покупки скота, минеральных удобрений и горюче смазочные материалы. Он заранее благодарить вас за вашу помощь и милосердие. Спасибо вам!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Since very early years Abduahad was interested in growing agriculture produce and animal husbandry. He always dreamed to have his own land and a lot of cattle to create his own farm. For more than seven years he has been in this business and tries to expand it. He is married and is a loving father of five children. The income which he receives from the business is spent on the needs of his family and expansion of the business. Abduahad wants to receive a loan in the amount of $3000USD to buy cattle, mineral fertilizer and fuel and lubricants. He thanks all of you in advance for your help and charity.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy cattle, mineral fertilizer, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, salt and rice.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 31-year-old woman. She is married and has two sons and one daughter. Her husband works in a blacksmith workshop with a modest income. Sahar has her own project, a grocery store, to help her husband cover life expenses. She wants to improve the grocery store situation by purchasing bulk quantities of groceries, but she hasn't enough money to pay so she needs to take out a loan of  $2,000 from FATEN. 

When Sahar takes out the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will pay to improve her grocery store and sell more to increase the family income and have better life conditions. Sahar is photographed in her grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase bulk amounts of groceries.

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: Christine est une femme âgée de 48 ans, elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est ferrailleur. Elle a 6 enfants. Christine travaille comme revendeuse de produits alimentaires. Le nom de sa boutique est « VIS-A-VIS ». Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter et revendre des cahiers en ce début d’année scolaire pour réaliser des profits.
texts.en: Christine is a 48-year- old woman. She is married to a man who is a scrap metal dealer. She has 6 children. Christine works as a reseller of general store food products. The name of her shop is "VIS-A-VIS". She gets her supplies at the big market in Lomé. She seeks her first loan to buy and resell notebooks at the beginning of the school year for a profit.

loans.use: to buy general store products

loans.name: Ndanu

texts.en:
Ndanu is a committed business woman, aged 42. She is married and blessed with four children. 

For the last 11 years, she has been selling tomatoes to bring up her family. In the next 5 years, she wants to become the distributor of tomatoes in her region. Her dream is to buy a car for transporting tomatoes. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Vafa

texts.en:
Vafa is 42 years old. She is married with three children. Since she has lived with her husband, she has worked in the business of buying and selling cattle. She currently has two cows and one cattle. She has about 15 years of experience in this field. She took advantage of the space she had available on her family’s land to start this business, which she runs together with her husband. Slowly her number of cows has increased, and her clients have started asking for more and more. Her monthly profit from cattle selling is 200 USD. 

With an endless list of requests, she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps, and for this reason she is requesting a loan. So she is asking for 1000 AZN in order to purchase more cattle.

loans.use: to purchase three calves

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a business man aged 36. He is married and blessed with one child. For the last 5 years, he has been selling timber to make a living. He has employed two people to assist him in the business. He has another source of income in dairy farming. 

In the next 5 years, he wants to become a major supplier of timber. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy a power saw.

loans.use: To buy a power saw

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 59-year-old married mother of two children. She has made special Saj bread for the past ten years. Her customers enjoy eating her special baked Traditional Saj bread, which they describe as baked with love, giving it this special taste.

Jamila is a hard working woman, and she insists on providing the best quality to her customers at the best price, too. Jamila is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua-KIVA partner, in order to buy necessary merchandise at good prices to provide the best quality food.

This is Jamila's ninth cycle as Al Majmoua borrower, with a perfect loan repayment history. All her previous loans had a positive effect on her business and social situation as she is also working hard to help her son to improve his living conditions and build his dream future house.

Jamila hopes to expand her shop and to increase the quantity of products she provides.

loans.use: to buy the necessary merchandise that will allow her to provide the best quality food.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr:
Dédé est une femme âgée de 58 ans. Elle est veuve. Elle a 06 enfants, dont un à l’école. Le premier a 35 ans et le dernier a 17 ans.  
Dédé travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1986. Elle achète et revend du charbon de bois à Lomé. Elle travaille  seule dans son commerce
Dédé a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon de bois et des céréales pour la revente. Elle veut profiter pour développer son commerce. 
Dans les prochaines années, Dédé voudrait agrandir son stock de marchandises.
texts.en: Dédé is a 58-year-old woman. She is a widow. She has 6 children, including one in school. The oldest is 35 years old and the youngest is 17 years old. Dédé has been working as a reseller since 1986. She buys and resells charcoal in Lomé. She works alone in her business. Dédé has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy charcoal and grain for resale. She wants to profit in order to develop her business. In the coming years, Dédé would like to grow her supply of goods.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Sadaqat

texts.en:
Sadaqat is 30 years old and a cattle breeder. She works at purchasing and reselling cattle with her brother. Sadaqat is a hard-working woman who has fought to provide for her family. 

She would like to request a loan of 1,000 AZN in order to purchase additional cattle to increase her inventory and to meet customer demands. Sadaqat believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. Her current monthly profit is about 150 USD and she wishes to increase it to 400 USD. 

In the future, she would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business. She will then purchase additional livestock and increase her income further.

loans.use: to purchase three calves in order to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a hardworking business woman aged 55. She is married and blessed with three children. For the past five years, she has been managing a private school to raise her family. Her other source of income is from her rental houses. Previously, she was involved in a business of selling groceries and clothes. 

In the next five years, Jane wants her school to become a boarding school. She is requesting for a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy textbooks. (This photo of Jane was taken when she was conducting a parent meeting at her private school.)

loans.use: to buy textbooks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three calves and to build a shelter for the livestock.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a hardworking business man aged 34. He is married and blessed with three children. For the past three years, he has been in the motorbike transportation business to make a living. He also sells milk to generate more income. Previously, he was involved in farming. 

In the next five years, he wants to become financially stable. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to open a milk sales shop. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to manage his business through the loan he acquires.

loans.use: to open a milk sales shop.

loans.name: Veronica Mwezu

texts.en:
Veronica is a 57-year-old widowed woman with four children ranging in age from 18 to 30. She describes herself as someone who enjoys sharing ideas with others. Veronica runs rental housing and lodging services for travelers. Her biggest business challenge is an area water shortage. 

Veronica is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase a plastic water tank to increase her water storage capacity. She hopes that in five years she will own an estate in town and have the young children in her family complete school and own their own property in future.

loans.use: to purchase a plastic water storage tank

loans.name: Kayitesi

texts.fr:
Kayitesi est salariée. Elle est née au Rwanda et a 48 ans. Elle est veuve et elle a 1 enfant de 20 ans, elle est scolarisée. 

C’est son quatrième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit pour acheter 4 tours des camions de sable, 15 sacs de ciments et payer la main d’œuvre pour la construction de sa maison.

Dans les prochaines années, Kayitesi voudrait bâtir d’autres maisons d'habitation à louer. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de développer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kayitesi is employed. She was born in Rwanda and is 48 years old. She is a widow and she has 1 20-year-old child She is educated. 

This is her fourth loan cycle with ACB. She is going to use her loan to buy 4 truckloads of sand, 15 bags of cement and to pay for the labor for the construction of her house. 

In the coming years, Kayitesi would like to build other houses to rent. With the profits, she plans to extend the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy 4 truckloads of sand, 15 bags of cement and to pay for the labor for the construction of her house

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a hardworking businessman. He is 28 years old, married, and blessed with one child. For the last three years, he has earned a living as a photographer. Previously, he was involved in farming. 

Joseph is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy a camera. In the next five years, he wants expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a camera

loans.name: Annah Mwasya

texts.en:
Annah is a 58-year-old married woman. She has six children ranging from 19 to 35 years old. For the past four years, Annah has operated a retail stall where she sells cups, soap bars, salt, bowls, plates, pens and exercise books. Her business is located in a market and her primary customers are students and other consumers. Annah describes herself as talkative and social. She describes her biggest business challenge to be frequent interruptions by the town council. 

Annah is requesting a 10,000 KES loan to add stationary stock to her store, such as pens and exercise books. Her business goal is to own a shop in town within five years. Annah hopes that in the future she will see her children and grandsons graduate from school.

loans.use: to buy stationary supplies, such as pens and exercise books

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is an 18-year-old single man from Ain. He has been working at raising livestock for five years. His family made him start working early because they need extra money for living expenses. 

Mahdi didn't finish his education  and he really feels sad for not doing so because he had a dream to  make come true but he knows all he's got are those loyA. friends.

Mahdi works hard at raising his livestock in clean and healthy surroundings, to  make sure that they will provide him with the best quality of milk to be sold. He sells his goats' milk and meat depending on customers' requests. He is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua, in order to built a suitable barn for his livestock and to keep their living place healthy and updated with the best equipment necessary for the winter season.

He hopes to increase his herd through future loans to be requested.

loans.use: To build a suitable barn for his herd.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gladys Mawia

texts.en: Gladys is a 33-year-old single woman. She has one daughter who is nine years old. She describes herself as jovial, patient, quiet, and responsible. She operates a greengrocery store. She has been involved in this business for three years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be loss of products due to the perishable nature of goods. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of potatoes, onions, tomatoes and cabbage. She hopes that within five years, she will be a bulk supplier of tomatoes. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her daughter to high levels of education.

loans.use: additional stock of potatoes, onions, tomatoes and cabbages.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a hard-working businessman aged 39. He is married and blessed with four children. For the last four years, he has  been selling plastic items, including plastic sandals, to make a living. He has another source of income in farming. In the next 5 years, he wants to operate a hardware store. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy plastic sandals and plates. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his money.

loans.use: To buy plastic sandals and plates.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open up a restaurant.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 41-year-old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 9 to 20. She considers herself to be a quiet woman. 

She operates a salon where she provides hairdressing, blow drying, and plaiting services to women. She has been in this business for three years and employs one staff member. She describes her biggest business challenges to be lack of capital to buy extra blow-drying machines, and frequent power shortages.

She will use her Kes 10,000 loan to purchase an extra blow-drying machine. She hopes that in five years, she will own a number of salons in the area and be the preferred salon for customers. She would like to open more salons so that she can create job opportunities for others. Her hope is to improve the standard of living for her family and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase an extra blow-dry machine for her salon.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a hardworking business man aged 38. He is married and blessed with four children. For the last five years, he has been operating a motorbike transport business to earn a living. He has another source of income in dairy farming.  In the next five years, he wants to buy a van. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings for servicing his motorbike.

loans.use: To service his motorbike.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a hardworking businesswoman. She is married and blessed with two children. She has been managing a tailoring business to make a living. She has another source of income in farming. Previously, she had a grocery store. In the next five years, she wants to have a big business. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Catherine Ayako

texts.en:
Catherine is a 35-year-old married woman. She considers herself to be a visionary woman. 

She operates a cereal store where she sells maize. Her business is located in a shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenges to be the poor road network and seasonality.

She will use her Kes 40,000 loan to purchase maize for sale in her store. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business into wholesale and buy a pick-up vehicle for transporting maize.

loans.use: to buy maize for her cereal business.

loans.name: Dushman

texts.en: Dushman, a 26-year-old businesswoman, is married and blessed with two children. For the last seven years, she has been managing an electronics shop to help support her family. Now requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy bulb holders and cables, within the next five years Dushman wants to expand her business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has become more business-oriented.

loans.use: to buy bulb holders and cables for her shop.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a committed businessman aged 20 and he is single. For the last eight months, he has been managing a motorbike transport business to make a living. In the next five years, he wants to buy a car for a taxi business. He is requesting a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy a motorbike. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his money.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her  business premises.

loans.name: Jones Kitheka

texts.en:
Jones is a 35-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 5 years to 15 years. He describes himself as quiet. He operates a greengrocery store. He has been involved in this business for three years. He describes his biggest business challenges to be shortage of commodities, for example oranges, and lack of enough funds to purchase more fruit.

 He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to introduce pineapples into his selection of goods for sale in his business. His business goal is to become a wholesaler supplying pineapples and other fruits within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to support his children to complete school, and he will own a house.

loans.use: to buy pineapples to add to his selection of goods.

loans.name: Margaret Mbula

texts.en: Margaret is a 40-year-old widowed woman with one grown up daughter. She describes herself as talkative and social. She operates a clothing sales store. She has been involved in this business for four years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more clothes to sell during the Christmas season. Her business goal is to open up a boutique in town within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her grandsons to become graduates.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
This is Emily, 40, a resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Edgar, a security guard, and mother to their three children. The eldest is already in college while the youngest is still in elementary school. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Emily operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg.  She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Emily hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business..

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, a single man who describes himself as patient, has operated a boda boda transport service employing one staff member for the past year. Describing his biggest business challenge as inflation, he will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy spare parts for his service.

Peter's business goal is to have more boda bodas in the area within five years, and he hopes to be able to offer the best area transport service in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his boda boda service.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia is a businesswoman aged 38. She is single and blessed with two children. She has been practicing dairy farming to bring up the family. Besides, she owns a cafeteria where she earns more income for her family. In the next five years, she wants her business to become successful. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to construct a cow shed and to buy some animal feed.Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has become business-oriented.

loans.use: To construct a cow shed and to buy some animal feed.

loans.name: Demtha

texts.en: Demtha is a businesswoman aged 27 and she is married. For the last 12 years, she has been operating a greengrocery  business to earn a living. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business  into many branches in her region. Her dream is to become the supplier of vegetables and fruit in the area. She is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy fruit, onions and vegetables. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save part of her income.

loans.use: To buy fruit, onions and vegetables.

loans.name: Matsoka

texts.en:
Matsoka is a 26-year-old man. He is not married and does not have any children yet. He sells music tapes, DVDs and other items to the local people. His business is located at a very busy market in Mombasa. He has been running this business for two years now. He says that the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is harassment from the local government since he is a hawker. He however works hard from early morning to late evening to ensure his business is doing well. 

Matsoka is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more music tapes and DVDs to grow his his business to wholesale and meet the demand of his customers. He describes himself as faithful.

loans.use: To buy movie tapes & DVDs.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is a hardworking business-woman aged 38. She is married and blessed with two children. For the last year, she has been selling curtain blinds to earn a living. Through Faulu Kenya, she was able to open a video shop which earns her extra income.  In the next five years, she wants to buy rental houses.  She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy curtain blinds.

loans.use: To buy curtain blinds

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is  a hardworking businessman aged 27 and he is single. For the last two years, he has been operating a pharmacy to earn a living. He has been able to retain his business because of his hard work and determination. In the next five years, he wants to open a clinic. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy medicine.

loans.use: To buy medicine.

loans.name: Omar Enrique

texts.es: Omar  es un hombre de 47 años de edad  que vive al suroccidente de la ciudad con su hermano y su familia;  allí se dedica a la comercialización de perfumes,  cosméticos y productos medicinales sin restricción. Su idea de negocio surge por la necesidad de generar ingresos autónomos,  y aprovechando su experiencia cuando fuera trabajador de una droguería. Su conocimiento  en el mercado lo llevaron a instalarse en un punto comercial donde él se ha posicionado. Sus ventas son diarias y principalmente de contado, pero también lo hace a crédito ocasionalmente;  inicialmente sus compras las realizaba a crédito, pero en la actualidad las hace de contado y ya es reconocido por sus proveedores. Aunque su local es pequeño tiene planes de ampliarlo y por eso día a día se esfuerza por trabajar para lograrlo. En la actualidad está solicitando su credikiva,  primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el fin de ampliar su capital de trabajo y comprar medicinas, productos como leche en polvo, y artículos de miscelánea que son los que en la actualidad presentan una mayor rotación.  Su sueño es generar  empleo a familiares pero es consiente que necesita crecer. En la actualidad maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas del 26% una rotación de inventarios de mercancías de 8 días indicadores desde los cuales proyecta su potencial crecimiento.
texts.en:
Omar is a 47-year-old man who lives in the south-west of the city with his brother and his family.  His business is selling perfumes, cosmetics and medicinal products without restriction.  His business idea came about due to his need to make his own income.  He made the most of the experience he gained when he worked in a drug store.  Omar's market knowledge led him to set up his business in a commercial location where he has managed to position himself.  He makes sales daily and mainly for cash.  However, he also occasionally sells on credit.  At first he purchased his goods on credit but he currently purchases them with cash and he is well known by his suppliers.  Although his premises are small, he has plans to extend them and he works hard every day in order to achieve this.

Omar is currently requesting a Kiva loan (the first loan he has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo) with the aim of increasing his working capital and buying medicines, products such as powdered milk, and miscellaneous items, which are those that currently have the biggest turnover.  Omar's dream is to make work for family members but he is aware that he needs to grow.  He currently has a return on sales of 26% and a stock turnover period of 8 days.  These indicators reflect his potential growth.

loans.use: to buy medicines, products such as powdered milk, and other miscellaneous items

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 45 years old and a single mother of three. To earn a living, she sells household items such as basins, buckets, pegs, blinds and table cloths.  She has been in the business for one year and has employed one person. She is also employed.  

Through Faulu Kenya, she has improved her business, hence improving her financial status.

She hopes to expand her business in the future. She needs a loan of 40,000 KES to buy blinds.

loans.use: To buy blinds to resell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years.  He is 28 years old, married to Beatrice, and they have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Moses hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, fruits, carrots, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is married and has one child.

He works as a tan boy (a trucker's assistant) and also does dairy farming to increase his income. 

He needs a loan to improve his dairy farming by buying animal feed.

In the future, he hopes to have a transport business.

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay her workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 29 years old and married. He has a 6-year-old child.  

He operates a van transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years. He also does dairy farming to earn extra income for his family. He has been able to boost his business through Faulu Kenya.

He hopes to grow his business within five years. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to service his van.

loans.use: To service his van.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hair chemicals and a hair drier.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred has operated her agrovet shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last one year. (An agrovet shop sells animal medicines and supplies.) She is 26 years old, married to Wanii, and they have one child.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officer and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more goods to resell in her agrovet shop.

In the future, Winfred hopes to grow her agrovet from only retail to also some wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more goods for resale in her agrovet retail shop.

loans.name: Athman

texts.en:
Athman is 30 years old and single. He owns a motorcycle and he is also a dairy farmer in Mariakani. His business has been in operation for the last two years and it has been a success. 

This marks his first borrowing from KADET to finance his business. Athman plans to expand his business by purchasing two more dairy cows. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. His dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to purchase two more dairy cows.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 24-year-old married lady. Elizabeth runs a retail shop in Voi. She has been in this business for the past year. 

Elizabeth has been a KADET client and this marks her first borrowing to finance her business. With this loan she plans to expand her business by purchasing sugar, salt, soft drinks, maize meal and wheat flour for her business. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand her business. 

Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: purchase sugar, salt, soft drinks, maize meal and wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase another sewing machine

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 46 years old and lives in Barnersville. She is married and has seven children between 14 and 29 years old; four are attending school, while three are working (business) and all of them live at home. Hawa did not go to school. For the past 21 years she has been selling oil, bitter ball, pepper and rice in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and likes the way people respond to her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, bitter ball, pepper, and rice for her business. She hopes to build her house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, bitter ball, pepper, and rice for her business

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Josefina tiene ya más 16 años dedicándose a la venta de artículos escolares (papelería).
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en compra de mercancía que son cuadernos, lápices, plumas, colores, tijeras, pegamento y hojas para copiadora, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la inversión ya que le están venden estos productos a muy buen precio, quiere aprovechar esta oferta y así poder realizar paquetes de útiles escolares y tener a la venta, y ayudar también a su clientes en el ahorro escolar. 
Desea mejorar su negocio y la calidad de vida de su familia.
Entre Doña Maria Josefina y su esposo el señor Victor Manuel son los que atiende el papelería  y cuidan de sus dos hijos. 
Con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio planea pagar el crédito ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Josefina  has been selling school supplies (paper products) for more than 16 years.

She is asking for the loan to invest in buying merchandise, such as notebooks, pencils, pens, colors, scissors, glue and copying paper. She doesn't have enough money to make the investment and they are selling these products to her at a good price. She wants to take advantage of this and be able to make packages of school supplies to sell, thus also helping her customers save some money on school expenses.

She wants to improve her business and her family's quality of life. Between Maria Josefina and her husband Victor Manuel, they run the paper store and raise their two children. With a part of her earnings from her business, she plans on paying off the loan since this is her family's main source of income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her paper business.

loans.name: Adan

texts.es:
Adan de 33 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio de luz solamente, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Zaña que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Adan desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (aves, vacas y cerdos), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados, los alimenta con comida balanceada, pastos y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un óptimo crecimiento para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para la compra de más animales y su respectiva comida, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Adan es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido sacar adelante a su familia con la finalidad de que logren su objetivo trazado.
texts.en:
Adan, who is 33 years old, lives with his wife and children in their own home, which has only light service, located in the rural area of the district of Zaña which belongs to the province of Chiclayo. This area is dedicated to agriculture, raising animals and tourism.

Adan, for some years, has been dedicated to raising and selling barnyard animals (poultry, cows and pigs). His pens are found behind his house, which is appropriate. He feeds the animals with balanced feed, pasture and natural grains so that his animals reach the optimal growth so that he can sell them in different markets in the area and obtain good earnings so he can pay his bills.

He has requested a loan of 2,000 new "soles" from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase more animals and their respective feed. With the earnings that he'll obtain from the sale of his animals, he will be able to cover his loan and have a better quality of life. Adan is a person who with effort and hard work has gotten his family ahead and achieved his objectives.

loans.use: to purchase animals and their respective feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: María Avelina

texts.es:
María tiene 51 años es soltera vive con su hijo en Ambato, su hijo tiene la esas de 28 años. María se desribe como una mujer algre y trabajadora.

Trabaja sola durante 15 años en la crianza de animales. Es la segunda vez que trabaja con FODEMI, el crédito que solicita actualmente es para la compra de terneros para seguir con la crianza de animales y aumentar sus ingresos y poder ayudar a su familia.

Su sueño es seguir invirtiendo para aumentar su negocio y obtener más ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old and lives with her son, who is 28 years old, in Ambato. She is described as a happy and hardworking woman.

Maria has worked alone raising animals for 15 years. This is her second loan with Fodemi. She is requesting this current loan to buy calves so that she can continue raising animals thereby increasing her income and her ability to help her family.

Her dream is to continue expanding her business and to make more income so that she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Koffi est  un homme âgé 51 ans. Il est marié å une institutrice qui est à la retraite. Il a 4 enfants, dont 2 à l’école. Le premier a 24 ans et le dernier a 18 ans.  
Koffi travaille comme directeur d’une école primaire depuis 2009. En ce moment, les toits de son école sont vieux.
Koffi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin de refaire le toit de sa maison. Il veut en profiter aussi pour construire d’autres salles de classe.
Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de subvenir efficacement aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Koffi is a 51-year-old man. He is married to a retired teacher. He has 4 children, including 2 in school. The oldest is 24 years old and the youngest is 18 years old. 

Koffi has been working as the director of an elementary school since 2009. At this time, the roof of his school is old. Koffi has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to redo the roof of his house. He wants to use it to build other classrooms. 

He says, with the profits, he plans to effectively meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: make the roof of a new classroom

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
Jovita de 35 años, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Chepen que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Jovita se dedica a la venta de ropa, negocio que a colocado en su domicilio desde hace unos un año, su mercadería que trae es para damas y caballeros, también trae a pedido, tratando de tener mayor demanda de clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Al observar que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1600 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y abastecer su tienda con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jovita is 35 and lives with her husband and children in her own home. She has basic services and lives in an urban area in the district of Chepen, part of the department of La Libertad. The area is characterized by its agriculture, livestock and tourism.

Jovita has sold clothing for one year and has her business in her residence. She carries clothing for men and women and she also sells on order. She tries in this way to increase demand from her customers and thus make more income to meet her family’s expenses.

Upon observing that her business is growing daily, she decided to request a loan of 1,600 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more merchandise and supply her store with fashionable items, so that her client base will continue to grow. In this way, she will be able to repay her loan and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Chérifatou

texts.fr:
Chérifatou est une femme  âgée de 27 ans. Elle est mariée å un employé de société. Elle a 3 enfants, dont 1 à l’école. Le premier a 6 ans et le dernier a 1 ans.  
Chérifatou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2001. Elle achète et revend des bijoux, mèches, savons défrisants pour ses clients servis dans sa maison.Elle travaille dans sa maison 
Chérifatou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des bijoux. Elle veut réinvestir dans son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Chérifatou voudrait faire prospérer ses activités. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Chérifatou is a 27-year-old woman who is married to a corporation employee. She has three children ranging in age from one to 6 years old. One of the children goes to school. 

Chérifatou has been working as a reseller since 2001. She trades in jewelry, hair extensions and hair relaxers, and she conducts her business from her home. 

Chérifatou is seeking her first loan from WAGES to buy jewelry. She wants to invest more capital in her business. 

In the coming years, Chérifatou hopes to see her business thrive. She plans to use her profits to ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy jewelry for resale

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia tiene 43 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona tiene como actividad agricultura, ganadería y turismo. 

Virginia desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno (vaca), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que sus animales llegan a su crecimiento óptimo podrá ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así pueda obtener muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más ganado vacuno para comercializarlo, con la finalidad de obtener más clientes e ingresos y así mejoraría  la calidad de vida de su familia.  Virginia es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que desea es que su familia se supere brindándole otras oportunidades.
texts.en:
Virginia is 43 years old.  She lives with her husband and children in their own home, which has water and electricity.  Their home is located in the rural area of Lambayeque, where people earn their living through farming, raising livestock, and tourism.  
For the past several years, Virginia has been raising and selling cattle (cows).  Her corral is located outside her house.  She feeds them nutritionally balanced feed and natural grasses.  Once her animals reach optimum growth, she sells them to various markets in the area, which enables her to earn very good profits and pay for her family’s expenses.  
She has requested this loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more cattle to sell. Her goal is to obtain more customers, earn more income, and improve her family’s quality of life.  Virginia is hard-working and very responsible.  The only thing she wants is to provide other opportunities for her family to succeed.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Jessica Maribel

texts.es:
Jessica de 33 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijo en su casa propia, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Chepen que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Jessica desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de productos de ferretería de forma ambulatoria en las afueras del mercado de la misma zona, para este rubro no existe mucha competencia, por la ubicación de su negocio su clientela es fluida y con los ingresos que obtenga por la venta de sus productos podrá cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para seguir comercializando a sus clientes, al incrementarse sus ganacias podrá cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Jessica es unamujere alegre,reponsable que consu trabajo saca adelante a su familia y quiere que su hijo tenga estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Jessica, 33 years old, lives with her husband and son in their own home with all utilities.  It is located in the urban area of the Chepen district, which belongs to the department of La Libertad.  Farming, ranching, and tourism characterize the area.

For 5 years Jessica has sold hardware products as a street vendor outside the market in the same area, where there is not much competition.  Because of the location of her business, customer business if fluid, and with the income made selling her products she is able to cover her daily household needs.

She has requested a loan with Edpyme Alternative of 2000 nuevos soles to buy more merchandise to continue marketing to her customers. By increasing her earnings she will be able to cover the loan given and improve her quality of life.  Jessica is a happy woman; responsible with her work, she helps her family move forward and wants her son to have higher education.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to implement her business.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel de 44 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Paijan que pertenece al deparatamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace algunos años Isabel se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos, golosinas), frutas y bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en casa para su  seguridad y comodidad, ya que puede atender a la hora que desea, con las ganancias por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y necesidades familiares.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para abastecer su negocio, con el único objetivo de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos que ofrecerles a sus clientes;  para cubrir su préstamo y sus obligaciones diarias.  Isabel es una persona responsable y dedicada que se preocupa por tener un negocio más grande y más comodidades en bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Isabel is 44 and lives with her family in her own home. She has electricity and lives in the district of Paijan, part of the department of La Libertad. This area is characterized by agriculture and cattle-raising.

For several years Isabel has sold groceries (milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs, sweets), fruit and beverages. Her business is in her home for expediency and safety, since she can serve customers at her convenience. With profit from the sale of her goods, she tries to cover all her family’s needs and expenses.

In order to run her business she has requested a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can buy more merchandise to stock her store. She wants her business to expand and to offer more goods to her customers. In this way she can repay her loan and meet her daily obligations. Isabel is a very responsible and dedicated person who wants to grow her  business and provide her family with more amenities and a greater sense of well-being.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to stock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase palm nuts and plantains

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa de 26 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería  y artesanía.

Rosa desde hace 3 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) y aves de corral, su corrales se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para qué pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su familia.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados y mejorar sus corrales, con los ingresos que obtenga puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Rosa es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia se supere y  tener mejoras económicas.
texts.en:
Rosa, 26 years old, lives with her husband and children in their own home. They don't have basic services (electricity, running water), since their home is located in a rural area of Tambogrande, in the department of Piura, an area known for its agriculture, livestock, and handicrafts.
Rosa has been raising and selling sheep and barnyard fowl for the past three years. Her pens, which are outside her house, are large and well kept. She gives her animals balanced feed, grains, and grasses so they'll grow quickly and she can sell them in the regional markets. The profits she makes from selling the animals allow her to pay for her family's daily expenses.
She has requested a loaan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 soles to buy balanced feeds and improve her pens. The increased income will help pay off her loan and improve her family's quality of life. Rosa is a hard-working, responsible person whose only desire is for her family to get ahead and be better off economically.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and improve her animals' pens.

loans.name: Mujeres Poderosas 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Evangelista a member of a group called "Mujeres Poderosas 1 & 2" (Powerful Women 1 & 2). This group is located in Puerto Plata, a rural port town on the north coast where the economy is based on tourism. Most of the group members sell products in this area.  Evangelista is a single mother and her home is a simple structure that she shares with her three children. Her most difficult challenge is to begin her new cafeteria business. Evangelista says that her business efforts will make it possible to provide for her family. In the meantime, she plans to continue to enjoy attending and participating in church and doing business.

Evangelista will use her portion of this group loan to invest in her butcher shop and she is planning to buy a cow to butcher and sell. She also sells boiled beans that neighborhood people buy to cook them faster at home. She began her business by selling these boiled beans and after she saved enough money she began buying meat such as chicken, beef, and pork, to start a butcher shop. Evangelista will save her profit to invest in her business and to save for the cafeteria that she would like to open soon. 

Evangelista is excited to receive her first loan through Esperanza Internacional because her loan will take her one step closer to expanding her business. In the future, she dreams of building a concrete house. Evangelista and her group thank you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy a cow to butcher

loans.name: Reynaldo De Jesus

texts.es: Reynaldo De Jesús tiene 24 años, es casado. El se dedica al negocio de la venta de ropa, el tiene una tienda de venta de ropa para damas y caballeros niños cosméticos. Pues inicio hace 6 años, pues siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar los ingresos de su familia el atiende a sus  clientes muy amable es así que sus clientes se sienten a gusto. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes entre otros.  Su meta siempre ha sido poder establecer mejorar su negocio, de tal manera que pueda vender al por mayor.
texts.en: Reynaldo de Jesus is 24 years old and married. For six years, he has had a shop where he sells women's, men's, and children's clothing. He has always worked hard to bring in more money to support his family, so he gives his customers great service so they'll feel at ease in his shop. He will invest his loan in buying pants, shirts, skirts, and suits, among other merchandise. His goal has always been to expand his business so he can sell his merchandise wholesale.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits, and so on.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José de 62 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio de luz solamente, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Pacora que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

José desde hace muchos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (aves y cerdos), su corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un óptimo crecimiento para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de más animales y su respectiva comida, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  José es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido sacar adelante a su familia con la finalidad de que logren su objetivo propuesto.
texts.en:
José Manuel, 62 years old, lives with his wife and children in their own home. They have electricity but no other basic utilities, since their home is located in a rural area of Pacora, in the department of Lambayeque. The main industry in the area is agriculture and livestock. 
José has been raising and selling barnyard animals (fowl and pigs) for many years. His pens, which are behind his house, are well kept. He gives his animals balanced feed and grains so they'll grow quickly and he can sell them in the regional markets. The profits he makes from selling the animals allow him to pay for his household expenses.
He has requested a loaan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles to buy more animals and feed. His earnings from selling his animals will help him pay off his loan and improve his family's quality of life. José has worked tirelessly to improve his family's situation so they can achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to supply her store

loans.name: Heberardo

texts.es:
Heberardo de 22 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona es agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Heberardo se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra maíz, actividad que realiza desde hace varios años, además de ser un producto consumido diariamente por las personas, una vez que realiza su cosecha lo comercializa en los diferentes mercados de la zona y fuera de ella,  con los ingresos que adquiera puede brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y esposa.

A observar que su negocio va creciendo y a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizante para mejorar sus tierras comosu producto, con las ganancias que obtenga podrá pagar su crédito y solventar las necesidades diarias de su familia.  Heberardo con trabajo y dedicación le brinda lo mejor a sus hijos, con la intensión de brindarles otra oportunidad académica en un futuro.
texts.en:
Heberardo is 22 years old.  He lives with his family in his own home, where he only has electricity (no running water).  His home is located in the rural area of the Tambogrande district, which belongs to Piura Department.  This is an area of agriculture, livestock and handicrafts.

Heberardo works in agriculture; he has his own farmlands where he grows corn, which he has been doing for several years; it's a product that's eaten daily by many people.  Once his harvest is ready he sells it in the different markets in and outside the area.  With the income that he earns, he is able to provide a better quality of life for his son and wife.

He has observed that his business is growing, and believed it necessary to request a loan for 1,500 New Soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  The loan is for the purchase of fertilizer to improve his land and his crop.  With the earnings that he will generate, he will be able to pay back his loan and cover his family's daily needs.

Heberardo wants to provide the best to his children, through hard work and dedication, with the intention of providing them with other academic opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to improve his land and his crop.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina tiene 33 años. Tiene 2 hijos que  asisten colegio Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa nueva. Ella tiene más de 13 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Ella es una mujer muy responsable y dedicada con su familia, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar muy fuerte. Inicio por cuenta propia ya que empezó vendiendo pantalones y ropa interior  por lo que ofrecía sus productos en su vecindario, fue aquí en donde inicio con este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de camisetas, pantalones, faldas, ropa interior y trajes.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is 33 years old.  She has two children who attend school.  Her work activity is selling new clothes, which she has been doing for more than 13 years.

She is a very responsible woman, who is dedicated to her family, which is why she has always been happy to work very hard.  She started by selling trousers and underwear, which she offered for sale in her neighborhood; this is how she began this business.

The financing that she is requesting is for working capital, which will buy T-shirts, trousers, skirts, underwear and suits.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, trousers, skirts, underwear and suits.

loans.name: María Lastenia

texts.es:
María tiene 44 años, es casada y tienen tres hijos, viven en Pelileo cerca de Ambato. María se describe como una persona de caracter y personalidad fuerte.

Trabaja con sus hijos en la crianza de animales (cerdos) para su reproducción, empezó 4 años atrás con un cerdo pequeño. Trabaja con FODEMI por un tiempo de tres años, el crédito que solicita actualmente es para la construcción de una chanchera y para la compra de dos cerdos de reproducción, lo cual ayudaría a mejorar sus ingresos y así poder dar a sus hijos el estudio superior.
texts.en:
María is 44 years old.  She is married with three children, and lives in Pelileo, near to Ambato.  María describes herself as a person of character, with a strong personality.

She works with her children raising animals (pigs) through breeding.  She began this business four years ago with one small pig. 

She has worked with FODEMI for a period of three years.  The loan that she is currently requesting is to build a pigpen and to buy two breeding pigs.  These will help her to grow her income and so be able to give her children a superior education.

loans.use: to build a pigpen and buy two breeding pigs.

loans.name: Lesbia Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Lesbia de profesion costurera, tambien trabaja en un preescolar, en donde lleva varios años laborando, el oficio de la costura lo aprendio con su familia siendo el medio para el apoyo de sus cinco hijos, hoy en dia casados.
Durante seis ciclos ha venido trabajando con financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado, todos para infraestructura, siendo el medio viable para estas mejora a su casa. con este nuevo prestamo hara el muro frontal para lograr mejor seguridad. Pues lo tiene tapado con zinc, lo que cada año tiene que estar cambianto madera lo que le resulta mas gastos.
Materiales a comprar, piedra, cemento, arena, hierro, tablas para comenzar la construccion de su tapia. Contenta por lograr cada dia un techo mejor.
texts.en:
Doña Lesbia is a tailor by profession and has also worked at a pre-school for several years.  She learned the craft of sewing as a means to support her family of five children.  Today her children are married.

She has been working with financing from Afodenic for six loan cycles, all for construction, as this is the most viable way to improve her home.  With this new loan, she will build a front wall in order to improve safety.  As her walls are covered with zinc metal sheeting, each year they must be replaced with wood, which becomes costly. 

She will buy stone, cement, sand, metal, and planks to begin the construction of her wall.  Each day, she is happy to be working toward her goal of having a decent home to live in.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build the front wall.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy  tiene 32 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Nancy desde hace 2 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno (vaca), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que tenga una buena producción de leche, la que ofrece a los mismos pobladores de la zona o lo lleva a vender al mercado de Piura, cuenta con clientela fija por la buena calidad de leche que tiene, con sus ingresos solventa sus obligaciones familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más alimentos balanceados para que se incremente la producción de la leche de vaca y así podrá ofrecerlo aun mejor precio para poder cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Nancy es una persona trabajadora y responsable que lo único que quiere es que con el negocio que tiene poderle brindar a sus hijos otras oportunidades académicas.
texts.en:
Nancy is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and children in their own home, which has water and electricity.  Their home is located in the rural area of Tambogrande, which belongs to the department of Piura.  People in this area are engaged in agriculture, raising livestock, and artisanal activities. 

For the past two years, Virginia has been raising and selling cattle (cows).  Her corral is located outside her house.  She feeds them nutritionally balanced feed and natural grasses to promote good milk production.  She sells the milk to residents of the area and also sells it at the Piura market.   She has regular customers due to the good quality of her milk and uses her income to pay for her family’s expenses.

She is requesting a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy nutritionally balanced feed in order to increase the production of cow’s milk.  This will enable her to sell it at an even better price in order to cover the cost of the loan as well as improve her family’s quality of life.  Nancy is hard-working and responsible.  The only thing she wants is to be able to use the income from her business to provide more academic opportunities for her children.

loans.use: to buy more nutritionally balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing notions

loans.name: Djromahouton Group

texts.fr: DJROMAHOUTON est un groupement constitué de onze personnes et dont le représentant(celui qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Noel. Les membres du groupement vivent dans le même village. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupement sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Noel est âgée de 35 ans et vit au Bénin. Noel est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Léonie. Le couple a quatre enfants tous à leur charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Noel n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Noel élève et vend des moutons et des canards. Noel exerce cette activité depuis vingt ans, ce qui lui permet ensemble avec sa femme, d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille. Noel s’approvisionne en provende pour ses animaux dans l'une des villes du Bénin. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à  Noel et aux autres membres du groupement DJROMAHOUTON de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: DJROMAHOUTON is a group of eleven people whose leader’s name is Noel (the one who is raising his hand in the photo). The group members live in the same village. In the goal of increasing their working capital, this group is seeking their first loan from ALIDé. Noel is 35 years old and lives in Benin. Noel is married to a saleswoman named Léonie. The couple take care of four children. Some of the children attend school. Noel has never gone to school. In order to provide for his family, Noel raises and sells sheep and ducks. Noel has been doing this for twenty years, which allows him and his wife to provide for their family. Noel stocks up on animal feed in one of Benin’s cities. This first loan will certainly allow Noel and the other members of the DJROMAHOUTON group to raise the level of their business and to increase their clientele and revenue.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Maria Balvina

texts.es:
María D. 59 años D. edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia,  cuenta con servicios D. agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito D. la Arena que pertenece al departamento D. Piura.  Toda esta zona sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

María se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. chicha D. jora (es una bebida rica elaborada a base D. maíz y  muy consumida en el norte del Perú) y harina D. maíz, esta actividad los realiza desD. hace 10 años aproximadamente, ya que es una costumbre que ha pasado D. generación en generación. Últimamente se ha incrementado las ventas D. la chicha D. jora en la zona donD. vive, lo que le ha favorecido para poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.

Teniendo la oportunidad D. crecer María a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1200 nuevos soles para comprar más harina D. maíz para la elaboración D. chicha D. jora y utensilios, con la finalidad D. obtener mayores ganancias y así sus clientes aumenten, para solventar el crédito otorgado y para que su familia se supere poco a poco; en especial sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 59 years old.  She lives with her husband and children in their own home, which has running water and electricity.  It is located in the district of La Arena, which is part of the Piura Department.  The people of this area work in agriculture and livestock.
