Elena, age 36, is married and has a daughter.  Her husband is a merchant, and he sells in various municipalities.  She has a store selling basic groceries.  She has been doing this for 16 years.  

She is requesting this loan to buy more food products and stock her business a little more.  This way she will have a greater variety of products to offer her customers.

Her dream is to expand her business and to give her daughter the best.

loans.use: to buy basic grocery products.

loans.name: Julio Marcelo

texts.es: Julio Marcelo es un hombre casado. Tiene 4 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es brindar polarización de vidrios para carros, oficinas, motos y adornos para estos mismos. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad. Empezó porque anteriormente él vivía en costa rica en donde logro aprender este medio de vida y decide establecerlo en su vivienda. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de calcomanías, cuchillos de corte fino, raspadores, entre otros. Su mayor sueño es seguir adelante con su negocio para proporcionarle a su familia las comodidades necesarias.
texts.en:
Julio Marcelo is a married man who has four children in his care.  His business activity is tinting windows of cars, offices and motorcycle taxis.  He also supplies vehicle accessories.  He has been in this humble business for more than 15 years.  He started out in this business because he used to live in Costa Rica where he learned this line of work.  He decided to set up business in his home.

The loan that Julio Marcelo is requesting will be used to buy decals, knives for precision cutting, scrapers, etc.  His biggest dream is to get ahead in his business so that he can provide his family with the conveniences they need.

loans.use: to buy decals, knives for precision cutting, scrapers, etc.

loans.name: Selso

texts.es: El Sr. Selso de 36 años actualmente separado y con un hija de 16 años se dedica a la venta de pancitas y anticuchos por la zona donde vive ya aproximadamente 02 años, además tiene otros ingresos como tractorista,  el crédito solicitado es para incrementar su negocio con la venta de caldo de gallina y así poder tener mejor ingresos y tener una mejor calidad de vida, su gran meta del Sr. Selso es el de poner su propio restaurante y el sueño de construir su casa, además está muy agradecido por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Selso, 36 years of age and currently separated, works with his 16 year old daughter in the sale of pancitas (tripe) and anticuchos (small pieces of grilled skewered meat) in the area where they have lived for approximately 2 years.  Moreover, he has other income as a tractor driver.  The loan requested is for the purpose of increasing his business with the sale of chicken soup and thus, be able to have a better income and quality of life.  Selso's big goal is to start his own restaurant and his dream is to build his home.  In addition, he is very grateful for the opportunity he's been offered.

loans.use: to increase his business

loans.name: Segundino

texts.es: Segundino de 37 años, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, convive con Graciela de 33 años de edad y fruto de esa relación tienen 03 hijos donde viven juntos en su propia casa. La labor que realiza Segundino es labrar la tierra, donde cultiva plantas de cacao, café y plátano, en total cuenta con 03 hectáreas de terreno y es conocedor del arduo trabajo que se ejerce en el campo; donde viene trabajando 10 años en sus propias tierras. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de cosechar y  trasladar los productos recolectados hasta cierto tramo para luego ser transportados con vehículos menores. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo; porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas le resultan, así obteniendo buenas ganancias; cuenta que la  estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque son meses donde abundan mayor cantidad de insectos las cuales perjudican sus cultivos. Con el crédito solicitado comprará plantas injertadas de cacao y café, para obtener mejores frutos en corto tiempo. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP y se compromete a aportar sus pagos en la fecha indicada, ya que desea acceder a otros préstamos posteriormente y esta muy seguro de que contará con el apoyo de los financistas. Con los 3,000 nuevos solicitados comprará plantas injertadas de cacao y café para así obtener mejores ingresos en corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Segundino, 37, is a native of the city of Santa Rosa. He lives with his partner Graciela, 33, and their 3 children, in their own house. Segundino works the land, where he grows cacao, coffee and bananas. In all, he has a 3 hectar plot  [about 7.4 acres] and is knowledgeable about the hard work that needs to be done in the fields, where he has been working his own land for 10 years. During the harvest he relies on the help of day laborers who are in charge of harvesting and transferring the crop to a small area, where it is then transported in small vehicles. 

Segundino is very committed to his work. Thanks to his efforts day after day, he is able to enjoy seeing his crop turn out well, thereby earning a good profit. He notes that the winter season is not to his liking because these are the months when the largest number of insects threatens his crops.  

With the loan he has requested, he will buy grafted cacao and coffee plants in order to obtain better yield in a short time. This will be his second loan with MFP and he is committed to making his payments on time since he wants to have access to other loans later and is confident he can rely on the support of lenders. As noted, he will buy grafted cacao and coffee plants with the 3,000 nuevos soles requested in order to obtain a better short term return.

loans.use: to buy grated cacao and coffee plants.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es: Mariluz de 30 años, es una mujer humilde y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Juan de 28 años y sus 02 queridos hijos, Abiud de 06 años y Romeo de 02 años de edad por quienes se esmera  a trabajar muy duro. Mariluz cuenta que se levanta muy temprano para preparar los alimentos para los miembros de su familia y luego alista a su mayor hijo para llevarlo al colegio, y luego dirigirse tranquilamente a la chacra en compañía de su pareja. Mariluz cultiva plantas de cacao, café, y variedad de frutas cítricas, productos importantes que le sirven de sustento para sobre salir y cubrir el gasto de educación de sus queridos hijos. Con las ganancias de sus cultivos situó una tienda de abarrotes en donde atiende los fines de semana y le va muy bien. Menciona que tiempos de cosecha y deshierbo de maleza necesariamente contrata jornaleros para poder avanzar con mayor celeridad en cuanto a su faena programada. Gracias a las sugerencias de sus vecinos optó en acercarse a MFP para solicitar su crédito ya que ella tiene referencias que nuestra institución presta créditos a las personas mas necesitadas con fines a invertir el dinero en algo prospero. Con el apoyo de todos ustedes espera concretar sus planes. Posteriormente piensa comprar más espacios de terreno para seguir labrando la tierra. Este es su primer crédito, por ello espera de la colaboración para poder comprar los productos sugeridos, como abono; a la vez se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cronogramas de pago ya que desea acceder a otros préstamos posteriormente. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles comprará sacos de abono ya que le servirán para mejorar sus plantas.
texts.en:
30-year-old Mariluz is an unassuming and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her partner, 28-year-old Juan, and their two beloved children, 6-year-old Abiud and 2-year-old Romeo, for whom she works very hard.

Mariluz tells us that she gets up very early to prepare food for her family and get her eldest son ready to take to school.  She then heads calmly towards her farm together with her partner.  Mariluz grows cacao, coffee and a range of citrus fruits.  These are important products that help her to get ahead and cover the education expenses of her beloved children.  With the profits that she made  from selling her crops, Mariluz set up a grocery store where she serves on weekends.  It is doing very well.  She mentions that during harvest seasons and weeding time she must hire laborers so that she can carry out the work that needs to be done more quickly.  Her neighbors suggested that she approach MFP to request a loan as our institution provides loans to those who are most in need and who want to invest money.

With the help of all of you, Mariluz hopes to carry out her plans.  In the future, she plans to buy more land so that she can continue farming.  This is her first loan and she hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can buy the products she needs such as manure.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time as she would like to be able to access further loans in the future.  She will use her 3,000 soles to buy sacks of manure which will help her to improve her plants.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure

loans.name: Mujeres Buscando Un Futuro Group

texts.es:
María tiene una vitrina donD. exhibe  lo que venD., tanto sus productos D. belleza como algunas golosinas como galletas, gaseosas, chocolates etc. este negocio lo tiene en su misma casa permitiéndole estar cerca D. sus hijos,  con los ingresos que obtiene D. su trabajo apoya a su hija que estudia enfermería por lo menos para su movilidad y algunos materiales indispensables para su carrera, pertenecer al grupo “MUJERES BUSCANDO UN FUTURO”  le permite tener sentido del ahorro y el progreso, debido a ello es que ha salido adelante logrando mantener su negocio tanto que ahora con su préstamo esta próxima a comprar una vitrina mas granD. que le permitirá tener mas productos y ventas  en el futuro ya esta viendo la posibilidad D. poner una bodega  en su casa cuenta con el lugar solo le faltaría acondicionarlo para empezar.

* María es la ultima D. la fila esta con chompa negra.
texts.en:
María has a display case for her products. She sells beauty products and sweets such as cookies, pop, chocolates, etc. The business is in her home, allowing her to be near to her children. With her income from this work, she supports her daughter who is studying nursing, helping her at least with transportation and various essential materials for her studies. Maria belongs to the "Mujeres Buscando un Futuro" ["Women in Search of a Future"] group. This allows her to feel that she is saving and progressing, and thanks to this group she has gotten ahead and been able to maintain her business and save. With this new loan she will purchase a larger display case which will allow her to have more products and thus more sales in the future. She sees the possibility of opening a grocery store in her home. She has the space and only needs to fit it out before she can start.

*Maria is the last in the line with the black sweater.

loans.use: to purchase a display case.

loans.name: Las Vecinas 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Casilda is the coordinator of her group, Las Vecinas (The Neighbors), and her group is located in the Samana Peninsula, a lush, rugged area with a nascent tourism industry where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Casilda is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling fried chicken. She has a Pica pollo (fried chicken restaurant). Casilda will use her loan to buy chicken, plantains, and fruits. Also, she is planning to buy a radio for her little restaurant. She will use the profits to invest in her business locale. She has her own locale and she wants to enlarge it. She also wants to buy medicine. 

Casilda's most important challenge is to build her house. She enjoys working and spending time with her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy chicken, plantains, fruits, soda, and a radio

loans.name: Anthony Steve

texts.es: ANTHONY, ES UN JOVEN ESTUDIANTE DE COMPUTACIÓN E INFORMÁTICA, TIENE 20 AÑOS Y ESTA YA EN LOS ULTIMOS MESES DE ACABAR SU CARRERA, ES UN JOVEN ESTUDIANTE CON MUCHOS DESEOS DE SURGIR Y SER EL ORGULLO DE SUS PADRES, TIENE LAS MEJORES CALIFICACIONES EN LA UNIVERSIDAD, TERMINANDO SU PRIMERA CARRERA PIENSA ESTUDIAR INGENIERÍA DE SISTEMAS, Y TRABAJAR EN UNA BUENA EMPRESA, EN SUS RATOS LIBRES AYUDA A SUS PADRE EN EL TALLER DE REPUESTOS DE AUTOS, CON EL RECIENTE PRESTAMO OTORGADO A ANTHONY LO INVERTIRÁ EN EL PAGO DE SU TITULO Y EL COMIENZO DE SU NUEVA CARRERA, UN MUCHACHO CON MUCHA RESPONSABILIDAD Y EMPEÑOSO EN LOS ESTUDIOS Y UNA META POR ALCANZAR.
texts.en: Anthony is a young 20-year-old computing and informatics student. He is in the final months of his degree. He is a young student with a great desire to succeed and make his parents proud. He has the best grades in the university. Upon finishing his first degree, he intends to study systems engineering and to work for a good company. In his free time he helps his parents in their auto workshop. With this recently authorized loan, Anthony will invest in the payment of his degree and the start of his new career. He is a guy with a lot of responsibility. He studies hard and he has a goal to achieve.

loans.use: to pay the qualification and his tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plastic for making baskets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Mirian es socia del Banco Comunal Totorilla, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, ella tiene una Marisquería de dia y Chifa por la noche, tambien tiene un recreo, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 3 años, recuerda que con su primer préstamo se compró una cocina, ella empezó su negocio, con una mesita y 4 sillas en un ambiente que le dio su papá, de ésta manera empezó su negocio agradece mucho por todo el apoyo que le brindaron, ya que gracias a Finca y la responsabilidad que le enseñaron, ahora ella tiene todo lo que se propuso, siente que ha progresado, las capacitaciones y el ahorro le ayudan a poder administrar mejor su negocio. La meta que tiene es poder comprar otro terreno y hacer bautizar a sus hijos.
texts.en: Mirian is a member of the Totorilla Communal Bank. She is 35 and has 3 children. She runs a seafood restaurant by day and a Chinese restaurant by night. She also has a tourist shop. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years. She remembers that with her first loan she bought a kitchen and started her business with a small table and four chairs in a location that her father gave her. She is very grateful for all the support that has been provided for her; thanks to Finca and the responsibility that they taught her, she now has all that she set out to have. She feels that she has progressed. The training and the savings help her to run her business better. Her goal is to be able to buy another plot of land and to baptize her children.

loans.use: to stock her food business.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar de 40 años de edad, natural de la comunidad de Triboline caserío de la ciudad de Sivia. Esta casado con Eugenia de 37 años y fruto de esa relación concibieron 02 hijos y habitan en su propio casa construido a base de material rustico madera y techo de calamina. Oscar con tanto cuidado logró reanudar su trabajo en áreas verdes, rodeado de árboles frondosos a la vez cultivados con plantas de cacao, café y árboles maderables, donde viene realizando esta actividad desde hace 15 años. Menciona que desde muy niño aprendió a arar la tierra gracias a la enseñanza de sus padres. Su producto mas rentable es la venta de café, porque los vende en cantidad  y a un buen precio,y gracias a las ganancias adquiridas, logró comprar animales de carga para facilitarse con el trnasporte de sus productos. La temporada de invierno no es de su agrado por la abundancia de insectos razón por la cual Oscar acude a la entidad Financiera para tramitar un préstamos y llevar consigo uno de sus propósitos, que es combatir la plaga de isnectos y salvar las florecillas de sus plantaciones. Los planes que tiene en mente es seguir sembrando y adquiriendo mas espacios de terreno para así sobresalir de la pobreza que convive su familia. Este es su tercer crédito y esta muy contento de  saber que tendrá el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar trabajando. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará insumos naturales para combatir los bichos que asechan sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Oscar, 40, is a native of the community of Triboline, a settlement in the city of Sivia. He is married to Eugenia, 37, and they have 2 sons and live in their own house, constructed of rustic wood material with a corrugated iron roof.

Oscar, with great care, succeeded in taking up green farming. He works surrounded by luxuriant trees at the same time as he cultivates his own cacao, coffee and timber trees, work he has been doing for 15 years. He mentioned that when he was a young child he learned how to till the soil thanks to instruction from his parents. His most profitable product is the sale of coffee because he sells it in a large quantity and at a good price. Thanks to his profits, he was able to buy pack animals to facilitate transport of his crops.

The winter season is not to his liking because of the abundance of insects, which is the reason he came to MFP, to request a loan and carry out another of his projects, which is to combat pest infestations and save the flowers in his fields.

Oscar’s plans are to continue planting and acquiring more land so that he can emerge from the poverty in which his family lives. This is his third loan and he is happy to know that he will have the support of each one of you to continue his work. With the loan he has requested, he will buy natural supplies to combat the insects that threaten his fields.

loans.use: to buy natural supplies to combat insects.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora es socia del Banco Comunal Capulí, tiene 47 años y 2 hijos D. los cuales 1 esta a su cargo junto a su nieto, ella tiene un Bar- Cevichería, que es una D. las mas concurridas D. Ayacucho, ella recuerda con mucha satisfacción como empezó, tenía como asientos las cajas D. cerveza y el techo era D. esteras, cuando no tenía cajas D. cerveza ponía troncos con ladrillos en forma D. asientos.
Dora es socia D. Finca ya casi 10 años, pueD. ver todo lo que ha progresado, con mucho agradecimiento recuerda como construyó su negocio, todas las capacitación le ayudaron a poder mejorar y estar en Finca ya es parte D. sus actividades, nunca se retiró, es muy constante y se siente muy feliz, y dice que nunca se retirará, ahora con el préstamo que esta sacando lo invertirá en su cevichería, ahora la meta a futuro que tiene es poder abrir una Discoteca.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of the Capulí Communal Bank. She is 47 and has two children, of whom one is under her care. She also cares for her grandson. She has a Bar-Restaurant specializing in fish and seafood. It is one of the most popular seafood restaurants in Ayacucho. With great satisfaction she recalls how she started: she had beer crates for seats and the roof was maD. of rush mats. When she didn't have enough beer crates she would put out logs on bricks.
Dora has been a member of Finca for almost 10 years. She can see how much she has progressed and recalls with great gratituD. how she built up her business. All of the training helped her to be able to improve. Being part of Finca is part of her life, and she has never withdrawn; she is very persevering. She is very happy, and says that she will never withdraw. Now, with this loan she will invest in her restaurant. Her goal for the future is to be able to open a discotheque.

loans.use: to purchase products and stock her business.

loans.name: Ros

texts.es: Ros, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, tiene 38 años de edad, ella es soltera alegre y trabajadora vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es brindarle lo mejor a su futura familia. Ros, es una mujer de ardua labor, se esmera a diario por entregar lo mejor de si misma a los miembros de su casta familiar. Ella se dedica al trabajo del agro donde siembra sus tierras con cultivos de café y cacao; viene realizando esta actividad hace 18 años con mucho cuidado y laboriosidad,  por que gracias a los frutos que le brinda sus plantas, ella compró una cuadra más de terreno para seguir cultivando. En tiempo de cosecha y deshierbo de maleza tiene que contratar jornaleros para poder avanzar con mayor celeridad en cuanto a su faena programada. Ella cuenta con espacios de tierra sin cultivar, lo cual inevitablemente necesita el apoyo de la entidad financiera para llevar consigo su trabajo, por ello tiene planeado sembrar sus fincas con más plantas de café. Para el bien de su trabajo, espera contar con la misma fuerza e ímpetu que la caracteriza para sacar adelante sus sembríos. Este será su crédito número 05 con MFP, por ello espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para seguir progresando y por ende se compromete en devolver puntualmente sus aportes programados. Con el dinero del crédito que solicita, comprará más semillas de café.
texts.en: Ros, from the city of Quimbiri, is 38. She is a happy and hard-working single woman. She lives in her own home and she most desires to offer the best to her future family. Ros is a very hard worker. She takes great pains everyday to offer the best of herself to her extended family. She is a farmer and sows coffee and cocoa. She has been doing this with great care and industriousness for 18 years. Thanks to her crops, she was able to buy another plot of land for cultivation. At harvest time and weeding time, she has to hire day workers in order to do her job more quickly. She has uncultivated lands and needs a loan to do this work. She plans to sow more coffee plants. She hopes to put the same strength and vigour as always into her new crop. This will be her fifth loan with MFP, and she hopes for the support of each of you in order to continue progressing. She promises to repay her quotas punctually. With the money from this requested loan, she will purchase more coffee seeds.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds.

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es: Zonia, de 26 años, es una mujer alegre y laboriosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Yuri de 27 años y su querido hijo, a quien desea brindarle una buena comodidad. En su querido pueblo de Rosario, Zonia ha pasado la mayor parte de su vida, desde muy niña aprendió la actividad familiar y es por ende que ahora es toda una conocedora de la actividad agrícola. Hoy trabaja en sus propias tierras al lado de su amado pareja donde viene cultivando cacao, café y árboles maderables, trabajo que le ha brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a los miembros de su familia. Todo lo cosechado, lo vende en los centros de acopio ubicado en la ciudad de San Francisco, lugar donde percibe mejores precios por cada uno de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los carros de carga son muy escasos por esta parte de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con el fin de incrementar su producción. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP y espera de un pequeño préstamo para poder cumplir sus objetivos y por lo cual esta dispuesto en cumplir con el pago respectivo de sus cuotas. Con los 3, 000 soles solicitados, adquirirá abonos y fertilizantes naturales para mejorar sus plantas y así sacar buen provecho en cuanto a sus frutos.
texts.en: Zonia, age 26, is a happy and hard-working woman. She lives in her own home with her partner Yuri, age 27, and their beloved son, to whom she wants to provide all the comforts. Zonia has spent the majority of her life in her beloved village of Rosario. From a very young age she learned the family business, and now she knows everything there is to know about farming. She now works on her own land with her beloved partner. They cultivate cocoa, coffee, and timber-yielding trees. This work has provided them with the necessary income to maintain their family. They sell everything that they harvest to the distribution centers in San Francisco city. There they receive better prices for all of their products. What she most enjoys about her work is sowing her lands, and she does so with great care. She has done this work for 10 years and finds the most difficult part to be transporting her products, since the freight cars are scarce in the Valle Rio Apurimac forest region. With time, she wants to buy new lands with the goal of increasing production. This will be her second loan with MFP, and she hopes for a small loan so that she can achieve her goals. She is prepared to repay her quotas. With the 3,000 requested soles, she will buy manure and natural fertilizers to improve her plants and thus benefit greatly from the harvest.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cacao seeds and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es: Teofilo de 35 años, natural de la comunidad de Lechemayo anexo de la ciudad de Quimbiri; convive con gregoria de 31 años y fruto de ese amor concibieron 03 hijos y cuenta además con su propia casa situado en la comunidad de Lechemayo. Teofilo, es el sostén de su familia. Desde muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra y hoy es todo un conocedor de la labor que realiza como agricultor y posee en total 03 hectáreas de terreno cultivados con plantas de café y cacao, plantas oriundas de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Viene trabajando 15 años en sus propias tierras y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los joranleros para  así avanzar con mayor  rapidez. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en la ciudad de san francisco, lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por lo cosechado. Su dificultad es; no poder contar con suficiente ingreso económico para solventar los pagos por adelantado a los jornaleros quienes le brindan el apoyo con las cosechas. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es sembrar más plantas de cacao ya que cuenta con 01 hectárea de terreno mas por cultivar. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, siente que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles solicitados, contratará jornaleros para que le brinden el apoyo en las cosechas de café y cacao ya que estos productos están en temporadas de cosecha.
texts.en:
Teofilo is 35 years old, from the Lechemayo area of the city of Quimbiri. He lives with Gregoria who is 31 years old and they have 3 children. They have their own house in Lechemayo. Teofilo is the bread winner of the family. His parents taught him as a young boy to work hard on the farm and today he is an expert farmer and owns a total of 3 hectares of cultivated land with coffee and cacao plants, plants native to the jungle area of the Apurimac River Valley. He has been working his own land for 15 years and during harvest time he has the help of laborers in order to get the harvest in mO. quickly.  
 
What he likes best about his job is to harvest the fruit of the land. He feels that the months of hard labor comes back in the quality of the harvest. The thing that is most difficult is transporting his products from the farm to the Acopio centers located in the city of San Francisco, the place that offers him better prices for the harvest. His difficulty is, he can’t count on sufficient income to pay in advance the laborers who help with the harvest. But now his highest priority is to plant mO. cacao plants because he has a hectare of land to cultivate.

This is his first loan with MFP. He feels that the money from the loan will help very much in the progress of his work. With the 2,000 soles he will contract laborers to help with the coffee and cacao crops and these products are in harvest season.

loans.use: to contract laborers

loans.name: Mario Genaro

texts.es: Mario Genaro es un hombre que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. El tiene 51 años y tiene 3 hijos a su cargo, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de ganado, el comenzó por la necesidad de tener otros ingresos ya que siempre la ha gustado sobrellevar los ingresos del hogar. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de vacas, toros, chivos y caballos. Uno de sus grandes sueños es hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Mario is a man who is eager to get ahead. He is 51 years old and supports 3 children. 

His source of income is selling cattle, which he began in order to have other income. He has always liked coping with the household income. 

The reason for this loan is to buy cows, bulls, goats and horses. One of his big dreams is to increase his business.

loans.use: to buy cows, bulls, goats and horses

loans.name: Teresa Jacqueline

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal 8 De Diciembre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Teresa, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, dos mayores de edad y dos de 17 y 14 años  los mismos que estudian en colegio, los mayores ya son profesionales y todos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es mecánico industrial.

Nuestra amiga para obtener sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa ya que muchos de sus clientes la visitan cuando necesitan una prenda de vestir. Trabaja tres o cuatro  días a la semana, deja a crédito  y cobra cada fin de semana. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a Quito cada vez que necesite. Tiene más de 18 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido  muy bien ya que tiene mucha clientela.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal 8 años  y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido. 

Sus sueños es ver que todos sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of the Province of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees, the members of the 8th of December Communal Bank get together every fifteen days. In this place we meet Teresa, 43 years old, married and from this relationship they have four children, two adults and the other two are 17 and 14 years old, and are studying at school. The older children are professionals and all of them live with her. Her husband is an industrial mechanic.

In order to earn her own money our friend sells all types of clothing. She sells door-to-door and also from her home and many of her clients visit her when they need something to wear. She works 3 or 4 days a week, granting the customers credit, which they pay on the weekend. Whenever necessary she goes to Quito to replenish her supply. She has been doing this for more than 18 years and she has done very well and has many clients.

The loan she receives will be used to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothing. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for 8 years and she likes it because the group is so united.

Her dream is to see that all her children finish their education and become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothing

loans.name: Miriam Elena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal 8 De Diciembre.

La señora Mirian es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque siempre su grupo ha sido muy responsable y unido. Tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero aun viven con ella. Su esposo es maestro constructor.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc. además de esto de lunes a viernes también se dedica a preparar deliciosos almuerzos ya que tiene un contrato con una empresa para entregar almuerzos al personal, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan cuando ellos pueden. Tiene más de 15 años dedicada su tienda y 2 años preparando los almuerzos.  Nos cuenta que esto le está dejando muy buenas ganancias y que la clientela aumenta más con el pasar de los días.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes y otros productos de primera necesidad.

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the communal bank 8 De Diciembre (8th of December) meet every two weeks. 

Mirian is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because her group has always been very responsible and united.  She is 49 years old and married.  She has two children from this relationship, both of whom are adults but still live with her.  Her husband is a master builder. 

Mirian has a grocery store in her home where she sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, cooking oils, detergents, etc. From Monday to Friday she also makes delicious lunches as she has a contract with a business to provide lunches to their employees.  She works every day from 6am to 9pm, and sometimes later.  Her children help her when they can.  She has had her store for more than 15 years, and has been making lunches for 2 years.  She tells us that her businesses are providing very good returns and her customer base grows with each passing day. 

This loan will be used to stock her store.  She will purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents and other basic goods.  

Her goal is to continue to move forward with her business and that her store keeps growing every day.

loans.use: to purchase rice, suger, cooking oils, detergetns and other basic good.

loans.name: Señor De Huanca Group

texts.es:
La señora Aydee nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donD. nació. (En la fotografía la señora Aydee está levantando la mano). 

La señora Aydee es viuda y tiene dos hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y responsable que saca adelante a sus hijos, ella tiene una lavandería y dos personas le ayudan con el negocio, ella mayormente trabaja con cadenas D. hoteles turísticos. Ya son 20 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

La señora Aydee desD. hace un año que pertenece al banco comunal “Señor D. Huanca” y le va muy bien, ella en su primer crédito que se prestó D. S/. 600.00 nuevos soles lo invirtió en el mantenimiento D. la maquinas lavadoras. En esta oportunidad Aydee requiere el préstamo para comprar cosas como por ejemplo detergerte, blanqueadores, perfumes y otras cosas más.  

Las reuniones D. las socias del Banco Comunal “Señor D. Huanca” son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco.  El banco Comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 

La mayoría D. los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y sus actividades económicas D. los demás socios son por ejemplo venta D. animales menores como cuyes, venta D.  comida, venta D. abarrotes, venta D. tejidos y venta D. miel. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una D. las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Sra. Aydee was born in the city of Cusco and lives there still. In the photograph she is raising her hand.

Sra. Aydee is a widow and has two children. She is a working mother and is responsible for helping her children to get ahead. She has a laudromat and two people who help her with the business. She mainly works in tourist hotel chains. She has been in this business for 20 years and it is going very well thanks to the dedication she gives to her work. 

Sra. Aydee has been a member of the "Señor D. Huanca" communal bank for one year and it's going well. For her first loan of 600 new soles she invested in the maintenance of washing machines. Now Aydee needs the loan to purchase things such as detergent, bleach, perfumes, and others. 

The members of the communal bank meet every 30 days in the city of Cusco.It is maD. up of workers and businesspeople who are always looking to get ahead and with their daily energy give a better future to their children. 

The majority of the the members live in the city of Cusco and the activities of the other members are, for example, animal sales such as guinea pigs, food sales, grocery sales, honey sales, and clothing sales. Cusco is known for being a very touristic zone, because of it's traditional Inti Raymi festival and because one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu, is found here.

loans.use: to purchase detergent, bleach, perfumes, and others

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco, de 27 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León, tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad, esta estudiando su Kindergarten mientras el se dedica a trabajar, el es mecánico automotriz, el aprendió este oficio por medio de su padre, quien le enseño a reparar autos, el tenia 14 años de edad, se especializo en mecánica automotriz. Después el decidió poner su propio taller de autos, también aprendió lo que es la soldadura. 
Realizo el préstamo comprar un compresor y unas herramientas de trabajos para reparar autos. Pues necesita tener herramientas nuevas para que le ayuden a repara bien los autos y maquinas modernas que le ayuden a realizar reparaciones externas de los vehículos. Como meta el quiere acondicionar mejor taller ,tener una buena estructura para guardar su inventario de repuestos.
texts.en:
Francisco is 27 years old and lives in the city of León.  He has a 4-year-old son who attends Kindergarten while Francisco works.  Francisco is a car mechanic.  He learned this trade from his father, who taught him to repair cars.  When he was 14 years old he specialized in school in auto mechanics.  Afterwards he decided to set up his own auto repair shop and also learned how to solder.  

He will use the loan to purchase a compressor and tools for his work repairing cars.  He needs tools because they help him repair the cars well and modern machinery that helps him do the body work on the cars.  His goal is to improve the structure of his garage so he can protect his parts inventory.

loans.use: to purchase a compressor and tools for repairing cars.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase materials for embroidering sashes.

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es:
El joven José Alberto está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprarle a su hermano menor un aparatos respirador, ya que se encuentra enfermo de Asma y necesita se aparato para poder respirar y tener un vida mucho mejor, 
José Alberto desea que su hermano tenga todo lo necesario para que tenga una vida norma y sin problema de salud, es por eso que solicita su cooperación para poder comprarle a su hermanito el aparato que necesita para respirar y pueda asistir ir a clase y podrá jugar con sus amigos. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su empleo en una tienda de muebles para el hogar como venderos.
texts.en:
Young José Alberto is requesting a loan so that he can buy a breathing device for his brother who has asthma and needs this machine in order to be able to breathe and lead a much better life.

José Alberto would like his brother to have everything he needs to lead a normal life without health problems.  For this reason, he is requesting your cooperation so that he can buy his little brother the device he needs to be able to breathe and attend class and play with his friends.  He plans to repay the loan with the salary that he makes from his job working as a salesman in a store that sells household furniture.

loans.use: to cover his brother's medical expenses

loans.name: Angela Mercedes

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal 8 De Diciembre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Angela, tiene 59 años de edad, hace varios años su esposos falleció pero de esa relación tienen 4 hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes.
 
Nuestra amiga se dedica a la agricultura y al comercio, ella tiene una finca en la cual cultivaba limón y cacao,  ella al fallecer su esposo se hizo cargo de seguir adelante con la producción. También hace poco ha construido unas piscinas en las cuales esta criando tilapias, nos cuenta que ya esta por sacar al mercado sus primeros peces para venderlos a comerciantes en los diversos mercados de Portoviejo, en sus trabajos cuenta con la ayuda de tres personas a quienes les paga un sueldo semanal. Nos cuenta que es un trabajo duro pero dice que le encanta lo que hace ya que está en contacto con la naturaleza.

Este crédito es para comprar fertilizantes y abono para los cultivos. Lleva 26 ciclos en el Banco Comunal, es la tesorera del grupo y le gusta porque el grupo es muy homogéneo y responsable.
 
Su meta es continuar adelante en sus negocios
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the City of the Reales Tamarindos Trees, the members of the 8 de Diciembre [Eighth of December] village bank meet every two weeks.

Here we meet Angela, 59. Her husband died several years ago but they did have four children together, now all grown up and on their own.

Our friend makes her living in agriculture and business.  She has a farm where she grows lemons and cacao.  When her husband passed away it was up to her to move ahead with the crops.  Not long ago she also installed some ponds where she's raising tilapia.  She tells us that she's just about to take her first fish to a number of Portoviejo markets to sell to the vendors.  She has three people helping her, whom she pays a weekly salary. She says that it's had work but she loves what she does because she's in contact with nature. 

This loan is to buy fertilizers for her crops.  She's done twenty-six loan cycles with the village bank. She's the groups treasurer, and she likes it because the group is very homogeneous and responsible.  

Her goal is to keep moving ahead in business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Fátima Beatriz

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal 8 De Diciembre.

En este lugar vive la señora Fátima, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 16 y 7 años de edad que estudian en colegio y  escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa de café.
 
Nuestra amiga para ganar algo propio se dedica al comercio. En su casa tiene un pequeño local en el cual vende accesorios y repuestos telefónicos, también realiza recargas y venta de tarjetas telefónicas de  todas las operadoras que hay en el medio, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00, nos cuenta que lleva tres años con su negocio y nos dice que esta es una forma de ganarse la vida sin tener que descuidar su hogar y sus hijos.
 
Este crédito es para comprar carcasas, repuestos telefónicos, tarjetas y recargas de teléfonos. Lleva 5 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda ya que con uno de los créditos puso su negocio.
 
Sus metas son seguir incrementando su negocio.
texts.en:
Members of the 8 de Diciembre communal bank meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, which is the capital of Manabi, and which has been known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Sra. Fátima lives here. She is 32 and lives with her common law husband with whom she has two sons, 16 and 7, who are in secondary and primary schools. Her husband works for a coffee company. 

In order to earn something of her own, our friend has a business. She has a small place in her home where she sells telephone accessories and spare parts. She also sells telephone cards for all the operators in the area and does refills. She works everyday from 8 a.m. until 10 p.m. She notes that she has had her business for three years and tells us that it is a way to earn a living without having to neglect her home or her sons.

This loan is to buy mobile phone cases, telephone spare parts and telephone cards and refills.

Her goal is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy telephone covers and spare parts as well as telephone charge and refill cards.

loans.name: Gilda Analia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal 8 De Diciembre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gilda, tiene 52 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, con ella vive uno de sus hijos que está por terminar sus estudios en medicina. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que les dan a todas las socias del banco.

Ella es fisioterapista y trabaja en una escuela para niños con problemas de aprendizaje (niños especiales), además de esto también en su casa tiene una óptica que la administra junto con el ex esposo el cual es oftalmólogo, nos cuenta que a pesar de estar separados ellos tiene esta sociedad en el negocio y que lo han tenido por más de 19 años y les ha dejado muy buenos ingresos ya que tienen muchos clientes que llegan hasta sus local por la calidad de la atención y servicio que ofrecen.
 
Este crédito es para comprar materiales para elaborar lentes como vidrios ópticos y marcos en toda medida y modelos para dar un buen servicio.

Sus metas son seguir adelante y que su hijo termine su carrera por completo.
texts.en:
Members of the 8 de Diciembre communal bank meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi and known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Here, we meet Sra. Gilda, who is 52 years old, divorced and who has four adult children. One of her sons, who is about to finish his medical studies, lives with her. She has been with the communal bank since its beginning and she likes the help that all of the members give one another.

She is a physical therapist and works in a school for children with learning disabilities (special education). She also has an optical office in her house that she runs together with her ex-husband, who is an ophthalmologist. She tells us that despite being separated, they have maintained this partnership in the business, which they have had for more than 19 years. It has provided them with a very good income, since many patients come to their office because of the quality of the care and the service they provide.

This loan is to buy materials to make eye glasses, such as optical glass and frames in all sizes and styles, in order to provide good service.

Her goals are to continue getting ahead and that her son finish his medical training.

loans.use: to buy optical glass and frames

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima -Jauja Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Elva emprendedora y luchadora  de 41 años de edad, soltera con 1 hijo menor de edad en etapa escolar ,es socia de la nueva alcancía comunal Santa Rosa de Lima-Jauja , se dedica actualmente  a la  venta de pasteles ,también se dedica  a la venta de productos unique ,como podemos observar Elva se dedica  a muchos trabajos con la intención de ser mejor cada día y dar a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida y buena educacion.Solicito este préstamo para poder  comprar más productos unique ,para  así  generar más ingresos y a la  vez poder tener más productos en oferta .Elva desea para el futuro tener una tienda en una zona comercial , para poder mostrar mejor los productos de unique .
En la foto Elva  viste  una casaca color negro y polo color mostaza, se encuentra ubicada a lado izquierdo de la Sra. que viste  una chompa color blanco.
texts.en:
Elva is an enterprising and combative woman who is 41 years old and single with a young son of school age. She is a member of the new Santa Rosa de Lima – Jauja communal bank. At present, she sells cakes and, also, 'Unique' cosmetics. As we can see, Elva dedicates her time to many jobs, with the intention of improving herself each day and providing her son with a better quality of life and a better education.

She is requesting a loan to buy more Unique cosmetics in order to generate more income and at the same time, to have more products to offer. 

In the future, Elva would like to have a store in the commercial zone, so she can better display these Unique products.

In the photo, Elva is wearing a black coat and a mustard coloured polo shirt, and is located to the left of the woman in the white sweater.

loans.use: buy more 'Unique' cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Patricia Leonor

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal 8 De Diciembre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Patricia, tiene 44 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y uno de 11 años, los mayores estudian en universidad y el menor en escuela, todos sus hijos aun viven  con ella.

Nuestra amiga para ganarse la vida y poder darles lo mejor a sus hijos hace 4 años puso una heladería en su casa, ella trabaja con la marca de Helados Pingüino pues dice que son los mejores helados, trabaja todos los días desde las 9h00 hasta las 21h00, sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio cuando ella no puede estar allí, nos cuenta además que aquí en su negocio a mas de ganarse el sustento diario también se entretiene y se olvida de todos sus problemas.

Este crédito es para comprar helados en todos los modelos y sabores, tortas heladas, colas entre otras cosas. Lleva 4 años y es la secretaria del grupo y le gusta por la responsabilidad y porque el grupo es muy ordenado.
 
Sus metas son seguir ampliando su local y adecuándole cada vez con mejores cosas para atraer a mas clientela.
texts.en:
The members of the "8 de Diciembre" [Eighth of December] village bank meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Reales Tamarindos Trees.

This is where we meet Patricia, 44. She's divorced from her husband, with whom she has three children: two grown and one eleven-year-old. The older children are in college and the younger one is in school. They all still live with her.

To earn a living and give the best to her children, our friend Patricia put an ice-cream parlor in her house. She sells Pinguin brand ice creams because they're the best. She works every day from 9AM until 7PM. Her children help her with the business when she can't be there. She also tells us that in addition to providing her a living, the business keeps her busy and she forgets all her problems.

This loan is to purchase all types of ice-cream, treats, ice-cream cakes, sodas, etc.  She's been with her group for four years and is the secretary. She likes it because the group is responsible and organized. 

Her goal is to keep growing her business and stocking it with the right products to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy ice-cream, ice-cream cakes, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Esteffany Jhoany

texts.es: La señorita Esteffany es una joven emprendedora y bien trabajadora, ella vende zapatos por catàlogo, lleva trabajando asi por mas de 2 años, es soltera y tiene grandes aspiraciones por progresar, solicita el prèstamo Kiva para comprar mas zapatos ya que se acerca la temporada de Primavera y verano y necesita abastecerse para esta temporada y poder atender a sus clientes, su gran sueño es tener su casa propia y poder independizarse de sus padres, hacer crecer su negocio y asi mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Esteffany is an enterprising and very hard-working young person.  She sells shoes by catalog and has been working at this for over 2 years.  She is single and has great aspirations to make progress.  She is requesting this Kiva loan in order to purchase more shoes, since the spring and summer seasons are approaching and she needs to be supplied for the season and be able to attend to her customers.  Her great dream is to have her own house and be able to become more independent from her parents, making her business grow and thus improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to implement her business

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is 27 years old and lives in Potungan, Concepcion. He is married and has one child. 

Raul has a shop that sells grocery items. He has had this business for two years. He requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase 10 boxes of assorted groceries. 

Raul has been a member of PMPC for a month.

loans.use: To purchase 10 boxes of assorted groceries

loans.name: Balsie Mary

texts.en:
Balsie Mary is 37 years old and lives in Poblacion, Mahayag. She is married with one child.
To earn a living, Balsie Mary has a business selling vitamins. She earns about 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of business. Balsie Mary has a requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase vitamins for her business.
Balsie Mary has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Balsie Mary would like to expand her business in rural communities.

loans.use: to purchase more vitamins for her business

loans.name: Ana Victoria

texts.es: La Señora Ana es una mujer trabajadora, tiene un pequeño negocio que se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (arroz, fideos, azucar, leche), golosinas, gaseosas, entre otros productos,  además tiene otros ingresos en la venta de comida  (desayuno, almuerzo y cena) que se dedica hace 4 años. El crédito solicitado es para invertirlo en la compra de estos productos (abarrotes, golosinas, gaseosas) y así poder implementar su negocio y abastecer mejor a sus clientes, el gran sueño de la Señora Ana es el de tener su propio Restaurante y así tener mayores ingresos que harán mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia. La Señora esta muy agradecida por el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
Ana is a hard working lady who has spent more than ten years in business selling staple goods.  In addition, for the past four years she has made a second source of income selling food.  

The loan she has requested is to make improvements to her store and at the same time improve her food sales business.  Ana's dream is to own her own restaurant so as to make a better profit which will improve her and her family's quality of life.  She is very grateful for the loan offered.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as rice, noodles, milk, sugar, chickens, and crackers

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung was born in 1987. She lives in Xom Thuong village, Uy No commune. She is married and has three small children. Her husband is a worker in Da Hoi. Her main job is farming. She not only grows rice and vegetables but also she sells cobbler. She has a store. 

She has a monthly income of about 7,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). Since 2010 she has participated in SEDA. The last time, she borrowed 5,014,000 Dong (VND) and repaid punctually. In this loan, she would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy cobbler to sell.

loans.use: to buy cobbler to sell.

loans.name: Rosielyn

texts.en:
Rosielyn is married with two children. She is 43 years old and lives in Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur.
Rosielyn sells dried fish to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. She has requested a loan for 20,000 PHP to purchase more dried fish for her retail store.
Rosielyn has been a member of PMPC for almost one year. In the future, Rosielyn hopes to earn a total income of 10,000 PHP each month.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her retail store

loans.name: Aliford

texts.en:
Aliford is 35 years old and lives in Cang-adieng, Siquijor. He is married with one child. 

Aliford has a small grocery store and earns approximately 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. 

He has a requested a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase assorted grocery items. 

Aliford has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month. In the future, Aliford hopes to grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase assorted grocery Items

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married with two children. She is 45 years old and lives in Sto. Niño, Mahayag.

Evelyn sells groceries to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 12,000 PHP to  purchase assorted products for her grocery store.

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Evelyn hopes to increase her capital and earn 7,000 PHP a month.

loans.use: to purchase assorted products for her grocery store

loans.name: Thuy's Group

texts.en:
Thuy was born in 1986. She is married with one child who is small. She lives in Xom Trong village, Uy No commune. Her family has a workshop. Her husband works there. Her husband is a mechanic. He has an income of about 4,000,000 Vietnam dong (VND) per month. Sometimes, Mrs. Thuy helps her husband in their workshop. In addition, she sells vegetables in the market. She has had this job for three years. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. This is the first time for her to participate in SEDA. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy more vegetables to resell.

About the other borrowers in her group:
T. is 33 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy food for pigs.
Lan is 31 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND for her small business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 54 years old and lives in Tungawan, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur. She is married and has three children. Gloria sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for almost one year. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. Gloria has been a member of PMPC for eight months. In the future, Gloria hopes to achieve a net income of 2,000 PHP per month.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is 55 years old and lives in Ramon Magsaysay Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and has five children. For the past four years, she has operated a business selling dried fish. Each month she earns almost 3,000 PHP doing this business. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to purchase more dried fish for her retail business. In the future, Julieta hopes that she can provide for her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en: Alberto is 38 years old and lives in Poblacion, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. He is married and has five children. Alberto sells fish for a living. He had been doing this for 20 years. He has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase dried fish. Alberto has been a member of PMPC since 2011. In the future, Alberto hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase two boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Vy, who was born in 1958, lives in Xom Trong village, Uy No commune, with her husband, who is a worker, and her son. Vy has had a clothing shop in the market for the past five years, earning a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong(VND).

Having participated in SEDA since 2007, she promptly repaid her last loan of 8,502,000 VND and is now requesting a loan of 9,810,000 VND to buy more new clothes to resell.

loans.use: to buy more new clothes to resell.

loans.name: Ka

texts.en:
There are many Cambodians who make a living as rice cultivators. One of them is Mr. Ka, who has been working in this sector since 2005. He and his wife grow rice on their own farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. They have four children. Two of the children are married and live independently, and the other two are living with him.

From this business, Ka earns about $3 each day. To create more output in their farming business, he and his wife would like to purchase more farmland, but lack money. He decided with his wife to request some funds through HKL, a partner with Kiva. He hopes that these funds will help him meet prosperity and gain more output.

loans.use: to purchase more farmland.

loans.name: Jane Glaiza

texts.en:
Jane Glaiza is 20 years old and married and lives in Poblacion, Salug, Zamboanga del Norte.

Jane Glaiza sells longaniza and hotdogs to earn a living and has had this business for one year. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase meat to make her longaniza and hotdogs.

Jane Glaiza became a member of PMPC this year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase meat to make her longaniza and hotdogs.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: This is Mrs. Kong, 35, a resident of the Ornlong Veng district of Siem Riep Province. She and her husband now generate their income with a farming business. Kong is married to Mr. Yon and has six children. To assist their income, Kong and her husband are working as thatch braiders. From this business they earn about $3.75 per day. To help continue the operations of their business, they would like to request some funds with the aim of purchasing a motorbike for operating their business on time. They hope that this fund will make their family meet happiness and gain more profit per day. As a last word, they are very thankful to all lenders that help their family to change their life.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is married with seven children. She is 60 years old and lives in Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte .

To earn a living, Zosima sells clothes. She has had this business for one year.  Each month, she earns approximately 4,000 PHP.  She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more clothes for her clothing business. 

Zosima has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Zosima hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her clothing business.

location.town: Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, ZAmboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 50 years old and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with five children.

To earn a living, Florita sells snacks.  She earns about 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Florita has a requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase juice and three sacks of bananas.

Florita has been a member of PMPC for over a year. In the future, Florita would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase juice and three sacks of bananas.

location.town: Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Sodbileg

texts.en:
Sodbileg is a 29-year-old widow who lives with her mother, son, and daughter.  They live in the outer ger district (a district without basic infrastructure) of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her mother is retired while both of her children attend the local public school. 

Sodbileg specialized in hospitality management at a local institute in 2005.  Since then, she has worked in restaurants for three years.  Currently, she rents a small restaurant which is located in a local district of the city and has been renting the restaurant since July of 2009. The restaurant received a special serving license when she started renting it, but now her special license has expired.  Sodbileg needs 900,000 MNT to renew the license, but she only has 300,000 MNT.  

So, she is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to renew her special serving license. She is a hard-working, young mother who wishes to do all the best things for her children.

loans.use: to renew her special serving license.

loans.name: Battumur

texts.en:
Battumur is 31 years old and lives with his wife and daughter, ages 3 in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family lives in a ger /Mongolian felt tent/ which is on his relative’s land plot, in outer ger district /district without basic infrastructure/ of the city. Battumur’s daughter Batzul attends kindergarten while his wife Ganchimeg is a student at local state university.  

Battumur has been supporting his family by operating a transportation business for past two years. In 2009, he started his transportation business using an old minivan.  Then he has sold his old minivan in 2010, and bought new one by nine million MNT /Mongolian Tugriks/ with leasing contract.  Today, he paid 7.5 million MNT using his business and his remaining amount is 1.500.000 MNT. Also he has 500.000 MNT which he earns.
  
For this reason, Battumur is requesting a 1.000.000 MNT loan to pay his remaining amount and finish leasing contract.  “Furthermore, I want to expand this business in order to buy one more minivan and fully support to my family”, he said.

loans.use: to pay for his transportation minivan leasing contract.

loans.name: Lua

texts.en: Lua was born in 1985. She lives in Xom Trong village with her husband and two children. Her husband is a carpenter. He has an income of about 3,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND) per month. Mrs Lua has a clothing store in the To market. She has been in this business for five years. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. In 2006, Lua joined Kiva partner, SEDA. Her last loan was for 8,502,000 VND. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to expand her clothing store by buying more new clothes.

loans.use: to expand her clothing store by buying more new clothes.

loans.name: Doeun

texts.en:
Doeun (shown in the photo with her loom) is a widow with one son, who is married. She lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  
Doeun is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.use: to purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Somaly and her husband, Samnang, are lotus farmers. In addition, Somaly’s husband is also a fisherman. They have been married since 2005 and live in a village along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 
Somaly is requesting another loan, of $1,000, to build a restroom and dig a well for family use.

loans.use: to build a restroom and dig a well for family use.

loans.name: Savet

texts.en:
Savet (shown in the photo) and her husband, Chamreun, are rice farmers. Additionally, Savet also sells Cambodian noodles in her village and her husband sells firewood. They have been married since 2001 and have five children – three sons and two daughters. Two of the children are in school while the other three are still young. The family lives in a village across the Mekong River, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.
Savet is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD to help maintain her farming business by purchasing seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Samoeun

texts.en:
Samoeun (shown in the photo), 45, is a widow with one son and three daughters. One of her children is a garment worker, one assists his mother in her business and other two are in school. Samoeun lives along National Road Number One, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
Samoeun is requesting her first loan of $1,000 USD to purchase a motorcycle for her nephew to drive to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her nephew to drive to work.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Loan was born in 1977. She lives in Xom Vang village with her husband and two small children. Her husband is a driver and Mrs Loan has a shop in the market where she sells shoes. Loan has worked in this business for four years. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. Since 2007, she has been a member of Kiva partner, SEDA. For her last loan, she borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to expand her shoe shop.

loans.use: to expand her shoe shop.

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Channa (shown in the photo) is a weaver, while her husband, Phalla, is a blacksmith. They have been married since 2002 and have two sons. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  
Channa is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Sotheavut

texts.en:
Sotheavut (pictured here), 32, is a construction worker. His wife is a garment worker. They have one daughter who is in school. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 
Sotheavut is asking for a loan of $500 to repair the house where he lives because it is broken down in some parts.

loans.use: to repair the house where he lives.

loans.name: Sokheang

texts.en:
Sokheang (shown in the photo with her son) and her husband, Sichann, are rice farmers. Additionally, Sokheang is also a tailor and her husband does construction work. They have been married since 2004 and have two young children – one son and one daughter. They live in a village along National Road Number Five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 
Sokheang is asking for a loan of $700 to buy fabrics for her tailoring business and rice seed.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for her tailoring business and rice seed.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy was born in 1977. She lives with her husband and daughter in Xom Trong village. Her husband is a driver and she has a shop in the market where she sells cosmetics and clothes. Thuy has worked in this job for three years. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has been a member of Kiva partner, SEDA, since 2007. For her last loan she borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid the loan punctually. For this, her seventh loan, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to invest in her shop by buying more shoes and clothes, with the purpose of having a better life.

loans.use: to invest in her shop by buying more shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Soksan

texts.en:
Soksan is a weaver. She has a supplemental pig farming business. Her husband, Chheang is a construction worker. They have three young children - two sons and one daughter. The family is living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Soksan hopes to expand her pig farming business by buying additional piglets and pig feed.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets to raise and pig feed.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 33 years old and lives in Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 3 children.

To earn a living, Maribel sells dried fish. She earns about 5000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Maribel has requested a loan of 9000 PHP to purchase 5 boxes of dried fish.

Maribel became a member of PMPC this year. In the future, Maribel would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchases 5 boxes of dried fish.

loans.name: Aramayis

texts.ru:
Арамаис родился в 1960 г. в селе Верин Хотанан (Verin Khotanan), имеет техническое образование. Девятнадцать лет он прослужил  в армии и теперь получает служебную пенсию. Жена Арамаис работает в магазине, дочь замужем и живет отдельно от родителей, старший сын работает водителем, а младший учится в Ереванском Архитектурно-строительном университете. Также, вместе с Арамаисом, проживает его мать, которая тяжело больна. 
Сельским хозяйством в селе Верин Хотанан Арамаис занимается с 1996г. На своей ферме он выращивает овощи, разводит крупный рогатый скот, кур, а также занимается пчеловодством. Арамаис продает на Капанском городском рынке овощи, говядину, молоко, яйца и мед со своей фермы своим постоянным покупателям, и таким образом содержит свою семью. Арамаису приходится работать на ферме и ухаживать за своей больной матерью самостоятельно, так как остальные члены семьи либо работают по найму либо учатся. 
Арамаису необходим кредит на сумму 500,000 драм, для приобретения еще одной коровы, а также сена.
texts.en:
Aramayis was born in 1960 in the village of Verin Khotanan. He has a technical degree. He served in the army for 19 years and now receives a military pension. His wife works in a store; his daughter is married and lives separately; the oldest son works as a driver, and the younger is a student at the Erevan University for Architecture and Construction. Aramayis’ mother, who is severely ill, also lives with him.

Since 1996, Aramayis has been working as a farmer in the village of Vernin Khotanan. At his farm he grows vegetables raises cattle and poultry and also keeps bees. Aramayis sells vegetables, beef, milk, eggs and honey from his farm at the market of the town of Kapan, to his loyal customers. This is how he supports his family. Aramayis has to work at his farm and take care of his ailing mother on his own as the other family members are either employed elsewhere or study. Aramayis needs a loan of 500,000 AMD in order to buy an additional cow as well as hay.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Nordeliza

texts.en:
Nordeliza is married with 4 children. Nordeliza is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Nordeliza sells snacks to earn a living. She has been doing this for 1 year. She has requested a loan of 2,000 to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, and juice to cook snacks.

Nordeliza has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Nordeliza hopes to have a better living condition and make her children professional.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, and juice to cook snacks.

location.town: Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Florencia Group

texts.en:
Florencia is 51 years old and lives in P-2 Cogon, Osamiz City. She is married with three children. Teresita has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase canned goods, a sack of rice, etc. Florencia has been a member of PMPC for seven months. In the future, Florencia hopes to be successful in her chosen business. 

Florencia is the leader of a two-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, a sack of rice, etc.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 64 years old and lives in Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children.
 
Angelina has a dress shop business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase more clothes for her dress shop. 

Angelina has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Angelina hopes to have a big dress shop in Aloran. She is happy as a member of PMPC because they can help with finances.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Sreng (in the photo) is a weaver. Her husband, Lorn, sells recycling materials. They have been married since 2005 and have two young children: one son and one daughter. The family is living on an Island in Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sreng is asking for a loan of $800 to pay school fees for her sister and to buy a motorbike for her sister to drive to school. Sreng’s sister just finished her baccalaureate degree. She wants to continue her study at the university in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her sister and buy a motorbike for her sister to drive to school.

loans.name: Zeny

texts.en:
Zeny is 52 years old and lives in Lawa-an, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with one child. 

To earn a living, Zeny sells goods such as canned goods, soft drinks, rice, corn, etc. in a general store.  She earns about 7,000 PHP each month doing this type of work.  Zeny has requested a loan of 14,9000 PHP to purchase more stock products for her general store.

Zeny has been a member of PMPC for five years.  In the future, Zeny would like to have a grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase more stock products for her general store.

loans.name: Samour

texts.en:
Samour and her husband grow small trees to sell. They operate their business from home. They have been married since 1982 and have two children - one son and one daughter. 

Their son is assisting them with the business, and their daughter is in university.  The family lives in a village aL. national road number two, about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Samour is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a laptop computer for her daughter. She will also use a part of her loan to buy materials for growing small trees such as sacks, land and fertilizer.

loans.use: To purchase a laptop computer for her daughter and buy materials for growing small trees such as sacks, land and fertilizer.

loans.name: Edelberto

texts.en:
Edelberto is married with one child. He is 29 years old and lives in Poblacion, Salug, Zamboanga del Norte.

Edelberto sells charcoal to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, he earns 20,000 PHP selling charcoal. He has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fifty sacks of charcoal.

Edelberto became a member of PMPC this year.  In the future, Edelberto hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase fifty sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 40-year-old married man and father of one child. He has been selling clothes since 2004. Mahmoud doesn't have a shop. He sells his products through his van by passing among most of the nearby villages. Mahmoud is known by most of the people, because of his special communication skills, and best customer service. He works hard on improving his business, through providing good quality products with special prices and increasing the collections he has.

Mahmoud is planning to get ready for the autumn/winter collection because he states that this time is the perfect time to get what you want at the best price. That's why he requested a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner, in order to buy them. It is his first time to deal with Al Majmoua. He hopes that this experience will have a positive effect on his business and social life, so he can provide his child with the best education and his family with healthy living. Mahmoud plans to change his van to a bigger one in the future, so he can increase his merchandise.

loans.use: To buy the new autumn/winter collection at special prices

loans.name: Nonie

texts.en:
